traits.desc: The marid can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Elemental Demise
traits.desc: If the marid dies, its body disintegrates into a burst of water and foam, leaving behind only equipment the marid was wearing or carrying.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The marid makes two trident attacks.

actions.name: Trident
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 13 (2d6 + 6) piercing damage, or 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Water Jet
actions.desc: The marid magically shoots water in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 21 (6d6) bludgeoning damage and, if it is Huge or smaller, is pushed up to 20 feet away from the marid and knocked prone. On a success, a target takes half the bludgeoning damage, but is neither pushed nor knocked prone.

spells: The marid's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: create or destroy water, detect evil and good, detect magic, fog cloud, purify food and drink
3/day each: tongues, water breathing, water walk
1/day each: conjure elemental (water elemental only), control water, gaseous form, invisibility, plane shift

traits.name: Two-Headed
traits.desc: The dog has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dog makes two bite attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw against disease or become poisoned until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 (1d10) on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

monsters.name: Stench Kow
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, poison

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the kow moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

traits.name: Stench
traits.desc: Any creature other than a stench kow that starts its turn within 5 feet of the stench kow must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all stench kows for 1 hour.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Death Tyrant
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone

traits.name: Negative Energy Cone
traits.desc: The death tyrant's central eye emits an invisible, magical 150-foot cone of negative energy. At the start of each of its turns, the tyrant decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active. Any creature in that area can't regain hit points. Any humanoid that dies there becomes a zombie under the tyrant's command. The dead humanoid retains its place in the initiative order and animates at the start of its next turn, provided that its body hasn't been completely destroyed.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (4d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Eye Rays
actions.desc: The death tyrant shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:

actions.name: 1.  Charm Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 17 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by the death tyrant for 1 hour, or until the death tyrant harms the creature.

actions.name: 2.  Paralyzing Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 17 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: 3.  Fear Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 17 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: 4.  Slowing Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: 5.  Enervation Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must make a 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: 6.  Telekinetic Ray
actions.desc: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 17 Strength saving throw or the death tyrant moves it up to 30 feet in any direction. It is restrained by the ray's telekinetic grip until the start of the death tyrant's next turn or until the death tyrant is incapacitated. If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The death tyrant can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

actions.name: 7.  Sleep Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 17 Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain unconscious for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on constructs and undead.

actions.name: 8.  Petrification Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must make a 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

actions.name: 9.  Disintegration Ray
actions.desc: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 17 Dexterity saving throw or take 45 (10d8) force damage. If this damage reduces the creature to 0 hit points, its body becomes a pile of fine gray dust. If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object or creation of magical force, it is disintegrated without a saving throw. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of magical force, this ray disintegrates a 10-foot cube of it.

actions.name: 10.  Death Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 17 Dexterity saving throw or take 55 (10d10) necrotic damage. The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 hit points.

legendary_actions.name: Eye Ray
legendary_actions.desc: The death tyrant uses one random eye ray.

traits.name: Axiomatic Mind
traits.desc: The pentadrone can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

traits.name: Disintegration
traits.desc: If the pentadrone dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind its weapons and anything else it was carrying.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The pentadrone makes five arm attacks.

actions.name: Arm
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Paralysis Gas (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The pentadrone exhales a 30-foot cone of gas. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Priest

traits.name: Divine Eminence
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the priest can expend a spell slot to cause its melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 (3d6) radiant damage to a target on a hit. This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If the priest expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d6 for each level above 1st.

actions.name: Mace
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

spells: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy
1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, guiding bolt, sanctuary
2nd level (3 slots): lesser restoration, spiritual weapon
3rd level (2 slots): dispel magic, spirit guardians

monsters.name: Drow Shadowblade

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Shadow Step
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the drow can teleport as a bonus action up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drow makes two attacks with its shadow sword. If either attack hits and the target is within 10 feet of a 5-foot cube of darkness created by the shadow sword on a previous turn, the drow can dismiss that darkness and cause the target to take 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. The drow can dismiss darkness in this way no more than once per turn.

actions.name: Shadow Sword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage and 10 (3d6) poison damage. The drow can then fill an unoccupied 5-foot cube within 5 feet of the target with magical darkness, which remains for 1 minute.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +9 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target regains consciousness if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it.

spells: The drow's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 13). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: dancing lights
1/day each: darkness, faerie fire, levitate (self only)

monsters.name: Yuan-ti Malison (Type 3)

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Medium snake, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It doesn't change form if it dies.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Malison Type
traits.desc: The yuan-ti has one of the following types:

traits.name: Type 1:
traits.desc: Human body with snake head

traits.name: Type 2:
traits.desc: Human head and body with snakes for arms

traits.name: Type 3:
traits.desc: Human head and upper body with a serpentine lower body instead of legs

actions.name: Multiattack (Yuan-ti Form Only)
actions.desc: The yuan-ti makes two ranged attacks or two melee attacks, but can constrict only once.

actions.name: Bite (Snake Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the yuan-ti can't constrict another target.

actions.name: Scimitar (Yuan-ti Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Longbow (Yuan-ti Form Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

spells: The yuan-ti's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 13). The yuan-ti can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: animal friendship (snakes only)
3/day each: suggestion

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.desc: The weasel has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 1 piercing damage.

monsters.name: Astral Dreadnought
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, stunned

traits.name: Antimagic Cone
traits.desc: The astral dreadnought's opened eye creates an area of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a 150-foot cone. At the start of each of its turns, the dreadnought decides which way the cone faces. The cone doesn't function while the dreadnought's eye is closed or while the dreadnought is blinded.

traits.name: Astral Entity
traits.desc: The astral dreadnought can't leave the Astral Plane, nor can it be banished or otherwise transported out of the Astral Plane.

traits.name: Demiplanar Donjon
traits.desc: Any creature or object that the astral dreadnought swallows is transported to a demiplane that can be entered by no other means except a wish spell or this creature's Donjon Visit ability. A creature can leave the demiplane only by using magic that enables planar travel, such as the plane shift spell. The demiplane resembles a stone cave roughly 1,000 feet in diameter with a ceiling 100 feet high. Like a stomach, it contains the remains of the dreadnought's past meals. The dreadnought can't be harmed from within the demiplane. If the dreadnought dies, the demiplane disappears, and everything inside it appears around the corpse. The demiplane is otherwise indestructible.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the astral dreadnought fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: An astral dreadnought's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Sever Silver Cord
traits.desc: If the astral dreadnought scores a critical hit against a creature traveling through the Astral Plane by means of the astral projection spell, the dreadnought can cut the target's silver cord instead of dealing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The astral dreadnought makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 36 (5d10 + 9) piercing damage. If the target is a creature of Huge size or smaller and this damage reduces it to 0 hit points or it is incapacitated, the astral dreadnought swallows it. The swallowed target, along with everything it is wearing and carrying, appears in an unoccupied space on the floor of the astral dreadnought's Demiplanar Donjon.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 19 (3d6 + 9) slashing damage.

legendary_actions.name: Claw
legendary_actions.desc: The astral dreadnought makes one claw attack.

legendary_actions.name: Donjon Visit (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: One creature that is Huge or smaller that the astral dreadnought can see within 60 feet of it must succeed on a 19 Charisma saving throw or be magically teleported to an unoccupied space on the floor of the astral dreadnought's Demiplanar Donjon. At the end of the target's next turn, the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

legendary_actions.name: Psychic Projection (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Each creature within 60 feet of the astral dreadnought must make a 19 Wisdom saving throw, taking 15 (2d10 + 4) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Illithilich
monsters.alignment: lawful or neutral (law/chaos axis) or chaotic or evil
monsters.damage_immunities: poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, lightning, necrotic

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the illithilich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed illithilich gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.desc: The illithilich has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The illithilich has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Paralyzing Touch
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 10 (3d6) cold damage. The target must succeed on a 18 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 21 (3d10 + 5) psychic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is grappled (escape 15) and must succeed on a 20 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned until this grapple ends.

actions.name: Extract Brain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one incapacitated humanoid grappled by the lich. 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the lich kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

actions.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The illithilich magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 18 Intelligence saving throw or take 27 (5d8 + 5) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary_actions.name: Tentacles
legendary_actions.desc: The illithilich makes one attack with its tentacles.

legendary_actions.name: Extract Brain (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The illithilich uses Extract Brain.

legendary_actions.name: Mind Blast (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The illithilich recharges its Mind Blast and uses it.

legendary_actions.name: Cast Spell (Costs 1–3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The illithilich uses a spell slot to cast a 1st-, 2nd-, or 3rd-level spell that it has prepared. Doing so costs 1 legendary action per level of the spell.

spells: The illithilich's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 20). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
Cantrips (at will): mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost
1st level (4 slots): detect magic, magic missile, shield, thunderwave
2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, invisibility, Melf's acid arrow, mirror image
3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, counterspell, dispel magic, fireball
4th level (3 slots): blight, dimension door
5th level (3 slots): cloudkill, scrying
6th level (1 slots): disintegrate, globe of invulnerability
7th level (1 slots): finger of death, plane shift
8th level (1 slots): dominate monster, power word stun
9th level (1 slots): power word kill
At will: detect thoughts, levitate
1/day each: dominate monster, plane shift (self only)

monsters.name: Pit Fiend
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Fear Aura
traits.desc: Any creature hostile to the pit fiend that starts its turn within 20 feet of the pit fiend must make a 21 Wisdom saving throw, unless the pit fiend is incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature is frightened until the start of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the pit fiend's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The pit fiend has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The pit fiend's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The pit fiend makes four attacks: one with its bite, one with its claw, one with its mace, and one with its tail.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 22 (4d6 + 8) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a 21 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned. While poisoned in this way, the target can't regain hit points, and it takes 21 (6d6) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 17 (2d8 + 8) slashing damage.

actions.name: Mace
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 15 (2d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 24 (3d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

spells: The pit fiend's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 21). The pit fiend can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect magic, fireball
3/day each: hold monster, wall of fire

monsters.name: Baphomet
monsters.damage_immunities: poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing that is nonmagical
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If Baphomet moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 16 (3d10) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 25 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

traits.name: Labyrinthine Recall
traits.desc: Baphomet can perfectly recall any path he has traveled, and he is immune to the maze spell.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Baphomet fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Baphomet has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: Baphomet's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Reckless
traits.desc: At the start of his turn, Baphomet can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against him have advantage until the start of his next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Baphomet makes three attacks: one with Heartcleaver, one with his bite, and one with his gore attack.

actions.name: Heartcleaver
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) slashing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (2d8 + 10) piercing damage.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 17 (2d6 + 10) piercing damage.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.desc: Each creature of Baphomet's choice within 120 feet of him and aware of him must succeed on a 18 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. These later saves have disadvantage if Baphomet is within line of sight of the creature. If a creature succeeds on any of these saves or the effect ends on it, the creature is immune to Baphomet's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary_actions.name: Heartcleaver Attack
legendary_actions.desc: Baphomet makes a melee attack with Heartcleaver.

legendary_actions.name: Charge (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Baphomet moves up to his speed, then makes a gore attack.

spells: Baphomet's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 18). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect magic
3/day each: dispel magic, dominate beast, hunter's mark, maze, wall of stone
1/day each: teleport

monsters.name: Magma Mephit

traits.name: Death Burst
traits.desc: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a burst of lava. Each creature within 5 feet of it must make a 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the mephit remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary mound of magma.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of fire. Each creature in that area must make a 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The mephit can innately cast heat metal (spell save 10), requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.
At will: heat metal

traits.name: Avoidance
traits.desc: If the displacer beast is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Displacement
traits.desc: The displacer beast projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the displacer beast is incapacitated or has a speed of 0.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The displacer beast makes two attacks with its tentacles.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an elf or undead, it must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Trampling Charge
traits.desc: If the mammoth moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a 18 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the mammoth can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 25 (4d8 + 7) piercing damage.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Mucous Cloud
traits.desc: While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is diseased for 1d4 hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater.

traits.name: Probing Telepathy
traits.desc: If a creature communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires if the aboleth can see the creature.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The aboleth makes three tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or become diseased. The disease has no effect for 1 minute and can be removed by any magic that cures disease. After 1 minute, the diseased creature's skin becomes translucent and slimy, the creature can't regain hit points unless it is underwater, and the disease can be removed only by heal or another disease-curing spell of 6th level or higher. When the creature is outside a body of water, it takes 6 (1d12) acid damage every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to the skin before 10 minutes have passed.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 15 (3d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Enslave (3/Day)
actions.desc: The aboleth targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed by the aboleth until the aboleth dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The charmed target is under the aboleth's control and can't take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance. Whenever the charmed target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the saving throw when it is at least 1 mile away from the aboleth.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.desc: The aboleth makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Swipe
legendary_actions.desc: The aboleth makes one tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Psychic Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: One creature charmed by the aboleth takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage, and the aboleth regains hit points equal to the damage the creature takes.

monsters.name: Yuan-ti Nightmare Speaker
monsters.senses: darkvision 120 ft. (penetrates magical darkness), passive Perception 11

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Medium snake or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. If it dies, it stays in its current form.

traits.name: Death Fangs (2/Day)
traits.desc: The first time the yuan-ti hits with a melee attack on its turn, it can deal an extra 16 (3d10) necrotic damage to the target.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack (Yuan-ti Form Only)
actions.desc: The yuan-ti makes one constrict attack and one scimitar attack.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 14) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the yuan-ti can't constrict another target.

actions.name: Scimitar (Yuan-ti Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Invoke Nightmare (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The yuan-ti taps into the nightmares of a creature it can see within 60 feet of it and creates an illusory, immobile manifestation of the creature's deepest fears, visible only to that creature. The target must make a 13 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 11 (2d10) psychic damage and is frightened of the manifestation, believing it to be real. The yuan-ti must concentrate to maintain the illusion (as if concentrating on a spell), which lasts for up to 1 minute and can't be harmed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the illusion on a success, or taking 11 (2d10) psychic damage on a failure.

spells: The yuan-ti's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 13). The yuan-ti can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
Cantrips (at will): chill touch, eldritch blast (range 300 ft., +3 bonus to each damage roll), mage hand, message, poison spray, prestidigitation
3rd level (2 slots): arms of Hadar, darkness, fear, hex, hold person, hunger of Hadar, witch bolt
At will: animal friendship (snakes only)
3/day each: suggestion

monsters.name: Guardian Naga

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: If it dies, the naga returns to life in 1d6 days and regains all its hit points. Only a wish spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must make a 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Spit Poison
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +8 to hit, range 15/30 ft., one creature. The target must make a 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The naga is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks), and it needs only verbal components to cast its spells. It has the following cleric spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): mending, sacred flame, thaumaturgy
1st level (4 slots): command, cure wounds, shield of faith
2nd level (3 slots): calm emotions, hold person
3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, clairvoyance
4th level (3 slots): banishment, freedom of movement
5th level (2 slots): flame strike, geas
6th level (1 slots): true seeing

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The firenewt can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The firenewt makes two attacks with its scimitar.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage.

actions.name: Spit Fire (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The firenewt spits fire at a creature within 10 feet of it. The creature must make a 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 (2d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.name: Shark Telepathy
traits.desc: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The sahuagin makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or spear.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

monsters.name: Archdruid

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Change Shape (2/Day)
actions.desc: The archdruid magically polymorphs into a beast or elemental with a challenge rating of 6 or less, and can remain in this form for up to 9 hours. The archdruid can choose whether its equipment falls to the ground, melds with its new form, or is worn by the new form. The archdruid reverts to its true form if it dies or falls unconscious. The archdruid can revert to its true form using a bonus action on its turn. While in a new form, the archdruid retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, and Dexterity are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any special senses, proficiencies, traits, actions, and reactions (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks. It can cast its spells with verbal or somatic components in its new form. The new form's attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances and immunity to nonmagical attacks.

spells: The archdruid is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, mending, poison spray, produce flame
1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, entangle, faerie fire, speak with animals
2nd level (3 slots): animal messenger, beast sense, hold person
3rd level (3 slots): conjure animals, meld into stone, water breathing
4th level (3 slots): dominate beast, locate creature, stoneskin, wall of fire
5th level (3 slots): commune with nature, mass cure wounds, tree stride
6th level (1 slots): heal, heroes' feast, sunbeam
7th level (1 slots): fire storm
8th level (1 slots): animal shapes
9th level (1 slots): foresight

monsters.name: Stone Golem
monsters.damage_immunities: poison, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The golem makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Slow (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Distress Spores
traits.desc: When the myconid takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it can sense its pain.

traits.name: Sun Sickness
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the myconid has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The myconid dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage plus 5 (2d4) poison damage.

actions.name: Pacifying Spores (3/Day)
actions.desc: The myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Rapport Spores
actions.desc: A 20-foot radius of spores extends from the myconid. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren't undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.desc: The weasel has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

traits.name: Echolocation
traits.desc: The bat can't use its blindsight while deafened.

traits.name: Keen Hearing
traits.desc: The bat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 1 piercing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The bear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The bear makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

traits.name: Iron Boots
traits.desc: While moving, the redcap has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

traits.name: Outsize Strength
traits.desc: While grappling, the redcap is considered to be Medium. Also, wielding a heavy weapon doesn't impose disadvantage on its attack rolls.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The redcap makes three attacks with its wicked sickle.

actions.name: Wicked Sickle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Ironbound Pursuit
actions.desc: The redcap moves up to its speed to a creature it can see and kicks with its iron boots. The target must succeed on a 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 20 (3d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.

monsters.name: Shadow Demon
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, fire, necrotic, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The demon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Light Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in bright light, the demon has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the demon can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 10 (2d6 + 3) psychic damage or, if the demon had advantage on the attack roll, 17 (4d6 + 3) psychic damage.

traits.name: Nimble Escape
traits.desc: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

traits.name: Khurgorbaeyag's Gift
traits.desc: Khurgorbaeyag saw fit to gift this goblin with powers that enable it to dominate others. The goblin has 1d3 other goblin||goblins that slavishly obey its orders.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Conjurer

traits.name: Benign Transportation (Recharges after the Conjurer Casts a Conjuration Spell of 1st Level or Higher)
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the conjurer teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that it can see. If it instead chooses a space within range that is occupied by a willing Small or Medium creature, they both teleport, swapping places.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

spells: The conjurer is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is intelligence (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The conjurer has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): acid splash, mage hand, poison spray, prestidigitation
1st level (4 slots): mage armor, magic missile, unseen servant*
2nd level (3 slots): cloud of daggers_, misty step_, web*
3rd level (3 slots): fireball, stinking cloud*
4th level (3 slots): Evard's black tentacles*, stoneskin

traits.name: Cunning Action
traits.desc: On each of its turns, the spy can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

traits.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
traits.desc: The spy deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the spy that isn't incapacitated and the spy doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spy makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Yuan-ti Malison (Type 1)

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Medium snake, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It doesn't change form if it dies.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Malison Type
traits.desc: The yuan-ti has one of the following types:

traits.name: Type 1:
traits.desc: Human body with snake head

traits.name: Type 2:
traits.desc: Human head and body with snakes for arms

traits.name: Type 3:
traits.desc: Human head and upper body with a serpentine lower body instead of legs

actions.name: Multiattack (Yuan-ti Form Only)
actions.desc: The yuan-ti makes two ranged attacks or two melee attacks, but can use its bite only once.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Scimitar (Yuan-ti Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Longbow (Yuan-ti Form Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

spells: The yuan-ti's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 13). The yuan-ti can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: animal friendship (snakes only)
3/day each: suggestion

traits.name: Mental Fortitude
traits.desc: The hatchling has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the hatchling to sleep.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The hatchling can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Yuan-ti Mind Whisperer
monsters.senses: darkvision 120 ft. (penetrates magical darkness), passive Perception 12

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Medium snake or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. If it dies, it stays in its current form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Mind Fangs (2/Day)
traits.desc: The first time the yuan-ti hits with a melee attack on its turn, it can deal an extra 16 (3d10) psychic damage to the target.

traits.name: Sseth's Blessing
traits.desc: When the yuan-ti reduces an enemy to 0 hit points, the yuan-ti gains 9 temporary hit points.

actions.name: Multiattack (Yuan-ti Form Only)
actions.desc: The yuan-ti makes one bite attack and one scimitar attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Scimitar (Yuan-ti Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

spells: The yuan-ti's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 13). The yuan-ti can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
Cantrips (at will): eldritch blast (range 300 ft., +3 bonus to each damage roll), friends, message, minor illusion, poison spray, prestidigitation
3rd level (2 slots): charm person, crown of madness, detect thoughts, expeditious retreat, fly, hypnotic pattern, illusory script
At will: animal friendship (snakes only)
3/day each: suggestion

monsters.name: Green Abishai
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the abishai's darkvision.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The abishai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The abishai's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The abishai makes two attacks, one with its claws and one with its longsword, or it casts one spell from its Innate Spellcasting trait and makes one claw attack.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage, or 6 (1d10 + 1) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or take 11 (2d10) poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The abishai's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 17). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: alter self, major image
3/day each: charm person, detect thoughts, fear
1/day each: confusion, dominate person, mass suggestion

monsters.name: Swarm of Ravens
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Swarm
traits.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny raven. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

actions.name: Beaks
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target in the swarm's space. 7 (2d6) piercing damage, or 3 (1d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

monsters.name: Bodak
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.languages: Abyssal, the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Aura of Annihilation
traits.desc: The bodak can activate or deactivate this feature as a bonus action. While active, the aura deals 5 necrotic damage to any creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of the bodak. Undead and fiends ignore this effect.

traits.name: Death Gaze
traits.desc: When a creature that can see the bodak's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the bodak, the bodak can force it to make a 13 Constitution saving throw if the bodak isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is reduced to 0 hit points, unless it is immune to the frightened condition. Otherwise, a creature takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage on a failed save. Unless {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised}, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the bodak until the start of its next turn. If the creature looks at the bodak in the meantime, it must immediately make the saving throw.

traits.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
traits.desc: The bodak takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Withering Gaze
actions.desc: One creature that the bodak can see within 60 feet of it must make a 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Jackalwere
monsters.damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The jackalwere can use its action to polymorph into a specific Medium human or a jackal-humanoid hybrid, or back into its true form (that of a Small jackal). Other than its size, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.desc: The jackalwere has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The jackalwere has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the jackalwere's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Bite (Jackal or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Scimitar (Human or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Sleep Gaze
actions.desc: The jackalwere gazes at one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target succumbs to a magical slumber, falling unconscious for 10 minutes or until someone uses an action to shake the target awake. A creature that successfully saves against the effect is immune to this jackalwere's gaze for the next 24 hours. Undead and creatures immune to being charmed aren't affected by it.

monsters.name: Erinyes
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Hellish Weapons
traits.desc: The erinyes's weapon attacks are magical and deal an extra 13 (3d8) poison damage on a hit (included in the attacks).

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The erinyes has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The erinyes makes three attacks.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 13 (3d8) poison damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned. The poison lasts until it is removed by the lesser restoration spell or similar magic.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The erinyes adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the erinyes must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monsters.name: Phoenix
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Fiery Death and Rebirth
traits.desc: When the phoenix dies, it explodes. Each creature within 60-feet of it must make a 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't worn or carried. The explosion destroys the phoenix's body and leaves behind an egg-shaped cinder that weighs 5 pounds. The cinder is blazing hot, dealing 21 (6d6) fire damage to any creature that touches it, though no more than once per round. The cinder is immune to all damage, and after 1d6 days, it hatches a new phoenix.

traits.name: Fire Form
traits.desc: The phoenix can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. Any creature that touches the phoenix or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage. In addition, the phoenix can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage. With a touch, the phoenix can also ignite flammable objects that aren't worn or carried (no action required).

traits.name: Flyby
traits.desc: The phoenix doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

traits.name: Illumination
traits.desc: The phoenix sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the phoenix fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The phoenix deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The phoenix makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its fiery talons.

actions.name: Beak
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 15 (2d6 + 8) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

actions.name: Fiery Talons
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 17 (2d8 + 8) fire damage.

legendary_actions.name: Peck
legendary_actions.desc: The phoenix makes one beak attack.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: The phoenix moves up to its speed.

legendary_actions.name: Swoop (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The phoenix moves up to its speed and attacks with its fiery talons.

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The shark has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.desc: The shark can breathe only underwater.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Skeleton
monsters.languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Distress Spores
traits.desc: When the myconid takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it can sense its pain.

traits.name: Sun Sickness
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the myconid has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The myconid dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The myconid uses either its Hallucination Spores or its Pacifying Spores, then makes a fist attack.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (3d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (3d4) poison damage.

actions.name: Animating Spores (3/Day)
actions.desc: The myconid targets one corpse of a humanoid or a Large or smaller beast within 5 feet of it and releases spores at the corpse. In 24 hours, the corpse rises as a spore servant. The corpse stays animated for 1d4 + 1 weeks or until destroyed, and it can't be animated again in this way.

actions.name: Hallucination Spores
actions.desc: The myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target is incapacitated while it hallucinates. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Pacifying Spores
actions.desc: The myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Rapport Spores
actions.desc: A 30-foot radius of spores extends from the myconid. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren't undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.

monsters.name: Xvart Warlock of Raxivort

traits.name: Low Cunning
traits.desc: The xvart can take the Disengage action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

traits.name: Overbearing Pack
traits.desc: The xvart has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to shove a creature if at least one of the xvart's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Raxivort's Tongue
traits.desc: The xvart can communicate with ordinary bats and rats, as well as giant bats and giant rats.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

spells: The xvart's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. it can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
Cantrips (at will): eldritch blast, mage hand, minor illusion, poison spray, prestidigitation
2nd level (2 slots): burning hands, expeditious retreat, invisibility, scorching ray
At will: detect magic, mage armor (self only)

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The bear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The bear makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning

traits.desc: The armanite has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The armanite's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The armanite makes three attacks: one with its hooves, one with its claws, and one with its serrated tail.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d4 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Serrated Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 16 (2d10 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Lightning Lance (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The armanite looses a bolt of lightning in a line 60 feet long and 10 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Yuan-ti Pit Master
monsters.senses: darkvision 120 ft. (penetrates magical darkness), passive Perception 11

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Medium snake or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It doesn't change form if it dies.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Poison's Disciple (2/Day)
traits.desc: The first time the yuan-ti hits with a melee attack on its turn, it can deal an extra 16 (3d10) poison damage to the target.

actions.name: Multiattack (Yuan-ti Form Only)
actions.desc: The yuan-ti makes two bite attacks using its snake arms.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Merrshaulk's Slumber (1/Day)
actions.desc: The yuan-ti targets up to five creatures that it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or fall into a magical sleep and be unconscious for 10 minutes. A sleeping target awakens if it takes damage or if someone uses an action to shake or slap it awake. This magical sleep has no effect on a creature immune to being charmed.

spells: The yuan-ti's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 13). The yuan-ti can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
Cantrips (at will): eldritch blast (range 300 ft., +3 bonus to each damage roll), friends, guidance, mage hand, message, poison spray
3rd level (2 slots): command, counterspell, hellish rebuke, invisibility, misty step, unseen servant, vampiric touch
At will: animal friendship (snakes only)
3/day each: suggestion

traits.name: Keen Sight
traits.desc: The nothic has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The nothic makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Rotting Gaze
actions.desc: The nothic targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Weird Insight
actions.desc: The nothic targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must contest its Charisma (Deception) check against the nothic's Wisdom (Insight) check. If the nothic wins, it magically learns one fact or secret about the target. The target automatically wins if it is immune to being charmed.

monsters.name: Cultist
monsters.alignment: lawful or neutral (law/chaos axis) or chaotic or neutral (good/evil axis) or evil

traits.name: Dark Devotion
traits.desc: The cultist has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The carrion crawler has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The carrion crawler can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The carrion crawler makes two attacks: one with its tentacles and one with its bite.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 4 (1d4 + 2) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the target is paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the poison on itself on a success.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The lizardfolk can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

traits.name: Skewer
traits.desc: Once per turn, when the lizardfolk makes a melee attack with its trident and hits, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage, and the lizardfolk gains temporary hit points equal to the extra damage dealt.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The lizardfolk makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or trident or two melee attacks with its trident.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Trident
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

monsters.name: Drow Elite Warrior

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drow makes two shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The drow adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the drow must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spells: The drow's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 12). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: dancing lights
1/day each: darkness, faerie fire, levitate (self only)

monsters.name: Flail Snail
monsters.senses: darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 10

traits.name: Antimagic Shell
traits.desc: The snail has advantage on saving throws against spells, and any creature making a spell attack against the snail has disadvantage on the attack roll. If the snail succeeds on its saving throw against a spell or a spell attack misses it, an additional effect might occur, as determined by rolling a d6:

If the spell affects an area or has multiple targets, it fails and has no effect. If the spell targets only the snail, it has no effect on the snail and is reflected back at the caster, using the spell slot level, spell save DC, attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the caster.
No additional effect.

The snail's shell converts some of the spell's energy into a burst of destructive force. Each creature within 30 feet of the snail must make a 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 1d6 force damage per level of the spell on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Flail Tentacles
traits.desc: The flail snail has five flail tentacles. Whenever the snail takes 10 damage or more on a single turn, one of its tentacles dies. If even one tentacle remains, the snail regrows all dead ones within 1d4 days. If all its tentacles die, the snail retracts into its shell, gaining total cover, and it begins wailing, a sound that can be heard for 600 feet, stopping only when it dies 5d6 minutes later. Healing magic that restores limbs, such as the regenerate spell, can halt this dying process.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The flail snail makes as many flail tentacle attacks as it has flail tentacles, all against the same target.

actions.name: Flail Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Scintillating Shell (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The snail's shell emits dazzling, colored light until the end of the snail's next turn. During this time, the shell sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet, and creatures that can see the snail have disadvantage on attack rolls against it. In addition, any creature within the bright light and able to see the snail when this power is activated must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the light ends.

actions.name: Shell Defense
actions.desc: The flail snail withdraws into its shell, gaining a +4 bonus to AC until it emerges. It can emerge from its shell as a bonus action on its turn.

monsters.name: Faerie Dragon (Green)

traits.name: The Colors of Age
traits.desc: A faerie dragon's scales change hue as it ages, moving through all the colors of the rainbow. All faerie dragons have innate spellcasting ability, gaining new spells as they mature. Red—5 years or less Orange—6–10 years Yellow—11–20 years Green—21–30 years Blue—31–40 years Indigo—41–50 years Violet—51 years or more A green or older faerie dragon's CR increases to 2.

traits.name: Superior Invisibility
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the dragon can magically turn invisible until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the dragon wears or carries is invisible with it.

traits.name: Limited Telepathy
traits.desc: Using telepathy, the dragon can magically communicate with any other faerie dragon within 60 feet of it.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The faerie dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 1 piercing damage.

actions.name: Euphoria Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a puff of euphoria gas at one creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 11 Wisdom saving throw, or for 1 minute, the target can't take reactions and must roll a d6 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior during the turn: 1–4. The target takes no action or bonus action and uses all of its movement to move in a random direction. 5–6. The target doesn't move, and the only thing it can do on its turn is make a 11 Wisdom saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The dragon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 13). It can innately cast a number of spells, requiring no material components:
1/day each: color spray, dancing lights, mage hand, minor illusion, mirror image, suggestion

monsters.name: Young Kruthik
monsters.senses: darkvision 30 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 10

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The kruthik has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The kruthik has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kruthik's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.desc: The kruthik can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 2½-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

actions.name: Stab
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The crab can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 11). The crab has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

monsters.name: Drow Priestess of Lolth

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drow makes two scourge attacks.

actions.name: Scourge
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 17 (5d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Summon Demon (1/Day)
actions.desc: The drow attempts to magically summon a yochlol with a {@chance 30|30 percent|30% summoning chance} chance of success. If the attempt fails, the drow takes 5 (1d10) psychic damage. Otherwise, the summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

spells: The drow's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 15). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
Cantrips (at will): guidance, poison spray, resistance, spare the dying, thaumaturgy
1st level (4 slots): animal friendship, cure wounds, detect poison and disease, ray of sickness
2nd level (3 slots): lesser restoration, protection from poison, web
3rd level (3 slots): conjure animals (2 giant spiders), dispel magic
4th level (3 slots): divination, freedom of movement
5th level (2 slots): insect plague, mass cure wounds
At will: dancing lights
1/day each: darkness, faerie fire, levitate (self only)

monsters.name: Piercer
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 8

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the piercer remains motionless on the ceiling, it is indistinguishable from a normal stalactite.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The piercer can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Drop
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, one creature directly underneath the piercer. 3 (1d6) piercing damage per 10 feet fallen, up to 21 (6d6). Miss: The piercer takes half the normal falling damage for the distance fallen.

monsters.name: Cambion
monsters.alignment: lawful or neutral (law/chaos axis) or chaotic or evil
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Fiendish Blessing
traits.desc: The AC of the cambion includes its Charisma bonus.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cambion makes two melee attacks or uses its Fire Ray twice.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Fire Ray
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +7 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 10 (3d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Fiendish Charm
