traits.desc: The drow knows when she hears a creature speak a lie in a language she knows.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The drow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drow makes three death lance attacks.

actions.name: Death Lance
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 18 (4d8) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage it takes. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

spells: The drow's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 18). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
Cantrips (at will): guidance, message, poison spray, resistance, thaumaturgy
1st level (4 slots): bane, cure wounds, inflict wounds
2nd level (3 slots): blindness/deafness, silence, spiritual weapon
3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, dispel magic, magic circle
4th level (3 slots): banishment, divination, freedom of movement
5th level (2 slots): contagion, dispel evil and good, insect plague
6th level (1 slots): harm, true seeing
At will: dancing lights, detect magic
1/day each: clairvoyance, darkness, detect thoughts, dispel magic, faerie fire, levitate (self only), suggestion

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The toad can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.desc: The toad's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) poison damage, and the target is grappled (escape 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the toad can't bite another target.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.desc: The toad makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the toad, and it takes 10 (3d6) acid damage at the start of each of the toad's turns. The toad can have only one target swallowed at a time. If the toad dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting prone.

monsters.name: Adult Oblex
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this distance), passive Perception 14

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The oblex can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Aversion to Fire
traits.desc: If the oblex takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Sulfurous Impersonation
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the oblex can extrude a piece of itself that assumes the appearance of one Medium or smaller creature whose memories it has stolen. This simulacrum appears, feels, and sounds exactly like the creature it impersonates, though it smells faintly of sulfur. The oblex can impersonate 1d4 + 1 different creatures, each one tethered to its body by a strand of slime that can extend up to 120 feet away. For all practical purposes, the simulacrum is the oblex, meaning that the oblex occupies its space and the simulacrum's space simultaneously. The slimy tether is immune to damage, but it is severed if there is no opening at least 1 inch wide between the oblex's main body and the simulacrum. The simulacrum disappears if the tether is severed.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The oblex makes one pseudopod attack and uses Eat Memories.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 5 (2d4) psychic damage.

actions.name: Eat Memories
actions.desc: The oblex targets one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 18 (4d8) psychic damage and become memory drained until it finishes a short or long rest or until it benefits from the greater restoration or heal spell. Constructs, oozes, plants, and undead succeed on the save automatically. While memory drained, the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from any ability check or attack roll it makes. Each time the target is memory drained beyond the first, the die size increases by one: the d4 becomes a d6, the d6 becomes a d8, and so on until the die becomes a d20, at which point the target becomes unconscious for 1 hour. The effect then ends. When an oblex causes a target to become memory drained, the oblex learns all the languages the target knows and gains all its proficiencies, except for any saving throw proficiencies.

spells: The oblex's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
3/day each: charm person (as 5th-level spell), color spray, detect thoughts, hold person (as 3rd-level spell)

monsters.name: Maw Demon
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning

traits.name: Rampage
traits.desc: When it reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the maw demon can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Eidolon
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The eidolon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object other than a sacred statue.

traits.name: Sacred Animation (Recharge 5-6)
traits.desc: When the eidolon moves into a space occupied by a sacred statue, the eidolon can disappear, causing the statue to become a creature under the eidolon's control. The eidolon uses the sacred statue|mtf's statistics in place of its own.

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.desc: The eidolon has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

actions.name: Divine Dread
actions.desc: Each creature within 60 feet of the eidolon that can see it must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, the creature must take the Dash action and move away from the eidolon by the safest available route at the start of each of its turns, unless there is nowhere for it to move, in which case the creature also becomes stunned until it can move again. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to any eidolon's Divine Dread for the next 24 hours.

monsters.name: Shadow
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The shadow can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow can take the Hide action as a bonus action. Its stealth bonus is also improved to +6.

traits.name: Sunlight Weakness
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the shadow has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

actions.name: Strength Drain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage, and the target's Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new shadow rises from the corpse 1d4 hours later.

traits.name: Adhesive Filament
traits.desc: The cave fisher can use its action to extend a sticky filament up to 60 feet, and the filament adheres to anything that touches it. A creature adhered to the filament is grappled by the cave fisher (escape 13), and ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage. The filament can be attacked (AC 15; 5 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage), but a weapon that fails to sever it becomes stuck to it, requiring an action and a successful 13 Strength check to pull free. Destroying the filament causes no damage to the cave fisher, which can extrude a replacement filament on its next turn

traits.name: Flammable Blood
traits.desc: If the cave fisher drops to half its hit points or fewer, it gains vulnerability to fire damage.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The cave fisher can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cave fisher makes two attacks with its claws.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Filament
actions.desc: One creature grappled by the cave fisher's adhesive filament must make a 13 Strength saving throw, provided that the target weighs 200 pounds or less. On a failure, the target is pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the cave fisher, and the cave fisher makes a claw attack against it as a bonus action. Reeling up the target releases anyone else who was attached to the filament. Until the grapple ends on the target, the cave fisher can't extrude another filament.

monsters.name: Empyrean
monsters.damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the empyrean fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The empyrean has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The empyrean's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Maul
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 31 (6d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of the empyrean's next turn.

actions.name: Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +15 to hit, range 600 ft., one target. 24 (7d6) damage of one of the following types (empyrean's choice): acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, radiant, or thunder.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The empyrean makes one attack.

legendary_actions.name: Bolster
legendary_actions.desc: The empyrean bolsters all nonhostile creatures within 120 feet of it until the end of its next turn. Bolstered creatures can't be charmed or frightened, and they gain advantage on ability checks and saving throws until the end of the empyrean's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Trembling Strike (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The empyrean strikes the ground with its maul, triggering an earth tremor. All other creatures on the ground within 60 feet of the empyrean must succeed on a 25 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

spells: The empyrean's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 23, +15 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: greater restoration, pass without trace, water breathing, water walk
1/day each: commune, dispel evil and good, earthquake, fire storm, plane shift (self only)

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The panther has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.desc: If the panther moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the panther can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Wererat
monsters.damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered
monsters.senses: darkvision 60 ft. (rat form only), passive Perception 12

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The wererat can use its action to polymorph into a rat-humanoid hybrid or into a giant rat, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The wererat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

actions.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: The wererat makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite.

actions.name: Bite (Rat or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wererat lycanthropy.

actions.name: Shortsword (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Aura of Madness
traits.desc: Creatures within 20 feet of the grue that aren't aberrations have disadvantage on saving throws, as well as on attack rolls against creatures other than a star spawn grue.

actions.name: Confounding Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (2d4 + 1) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 10 Wisdom saving throw or attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of the grue's next turn.

traits.name: Lightning Blood
traits.desc: A creature within 5 feet of the death kiss takes 5 (1d10) lightning damage whenever it hits the death kiss with a melee attack that deals piercing or slashing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The death kiss makes three tentacle attacks. Up to three of these attacks can be replaced by Blood Drain, one replacement per tentacle grappling a creature

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 14 (3d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 14) if it is a Huge or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the death kiss can't use the same tentacle on another target. The death kiss has ten tentacles.

actions.name: Blood Drain
actions.desc: One creature grappled by a tentacle of the death kiss must make a 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 22 (4d10) lightning damage, and the death kiss regains half as many hit points.

monsters.name: Silver Dragon Wyrmling
monsters.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 14

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Breath Weapons (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

actions.name: Cold Breath
actions.desc: The dragon exhales an icy blast in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Paralyzing Breath
actions.desc: The dragon exhales paralyzing gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Gelatinous Cube
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, prone
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 8

traits.name: Ooze Cube
traits.desc: The cube takes up its entire space. Other creatures can enter the space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the cube's Engulf and has disadvantage on the saving throw. Creatures inside the cube can be seen but have total cover. A creature within 5 feet of the cube can take an action to pull a creature or object out of the cube. Doing so requires a successful 12 Strength check, and the creature making the attempt takes 10 (3d6) acid damage. The cube can hold only one Large creature or up to four Medium or smaller creatures inside it at a time.

traits.name: Transparent
traits.desc: Even when the cube is in plain sight, it takes a successful 15 Wisdom (Perception) check to spot a cube that has neither moved nor attacked. A creature that tries to enter the cube's space while unaware of the cube is {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} by the cube.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 10 (3d6) acid damage.

actions.name: Engulf
actions.desc: The cube moves up to its speed. While doing so, it can enter Large or smaller creatures' spaces. Whenever the cube enters a creature's space, the creature must make a 12 Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the cube. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw. On a failed save, the cube enters the creature's space, and the creature takes 10 (3d6) acid damage and is engulfed. The engulfed creature can't breathe, is restrained, and takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the cube's turns. When the cube moves, the engulfed creature moves with it. An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a 12 Strength check. On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the cube.

monsters.name: Mind Flayer Psion

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The mind flayer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 15 (2d10 + 4) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape 15) and must succeed on a 15 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned until this grapple ends.

actions.name: Extract Brain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one incapacitated humanoid grappled by the mind flayer. The target takes 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the mind flayer kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

actions.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The mind flayer magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 15 Intelligence saving throw or take 22 (4d8 + 4) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The mind flayer is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 15; +7 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
1st level (4 slots): charm person, command, comprehend languages, sanctuary
2nd level (3 slots): crown of madness, phantasmal force, see invisibility
3rd level (3 slots): clairvoyance, fear, meld into stone
4th level (3 slots): confusion, stone shape
5th level (2 slots): scrying, telekinesis
At will: guidance, mage hand, vicious mockery, true strike

traits.name: Brave
traits.desc: The gladiator has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

traits.name: Brute
traits.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the gladiator hits with it (included in the attack).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The gladiator makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Shield Bash
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The gladiator adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the gladiator must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

traits.name: Trampling Charge
traits.desc: If the elephant moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the elephant can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the girallon can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The girallon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The girallon makes five attacks: one with its bite and four with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit. reach 10 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Yuan-ti Abomination

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Large snake, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It doesn't change form if it dies.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack (Abomination Form Only)
actions.desc: The yuan-ti makes two ranged attacks or three melee attacks, but can use its bite and constrict attacks only once each.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the yuan-ti can't constrict another target.

actions.name: Scimitar (Abomination Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Longbow (Abomination Form Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

spells: The yuan-ti's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 15). The yuan-ti can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: animal friendship (snakes only)
3/day each: suggestion
1/day each: fear

traits.name: Poor Depth Perception
traits.desc: The cyclops has disadvantage on any attack roll against a target more than 30 feet away.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cyclops makes two greatclub attacks.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +9 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Firenewt Warlock of Imix
monsters.senses: darkvision 120 ft. (penetrates magical darkness), passive Perception 10

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The firenewt can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Imix's Blessing
traits.desc: When the firenewt reduces an enemy to 0 hit points, the firenewt gains 5 temporary hit points.

actions.name: Morningstar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

spells: The firenewt's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast mage armor (self only) at will, requiring no material components.
Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, guidance, light, mage hand, prestidigitation
2nd level (2 slots): burning hands, flaming sphere, hellish rebuke, scorching ray
At will: mage armor

traits.name: Echolocation
traits.desc: The bat can't use its blindsight while deafened.

traits.name: Keen Hearing
traits.desc: The bat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Rampage
traits.desc: When the gnoll reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the gnoll can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The gnoll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its shortsword.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Sudden Rush
actions.desc: Until the end of the turn, the gnoll's speed increases by 60 feet and it doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The troll has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Poison Splash
traits.desc: When the troll takes damage of any type but psychic, each creature within 5 feet of the troll takes 9 (2d8) poison damage.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage, and the creature is poisoned until the start of the troll's next turn.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage.

actions.name: Venom Spray (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The troll slices itself with a claw, releasing a spray of poison in a 15-foot cube. The troll takes 7 (2d6) slashing damage (this damage can't be reduced in any way). Each creature in the area must make a 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 18 (4d8) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned. A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.desc: The sea horse can breathe only underwater.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (3d6) poison damage. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

monsters.name: Ancient Blue Dragon
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 27

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 20 (2d10 + 9) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) lightning damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 16 (2d6 + 9) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 18 (2d8 + 9) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.desc: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a 20 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales lightning in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a 23 Dexterity saving throw, taking 88 (16d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the dragon must succeed on a 24 Dexterity saving throw or take 16 (2d6 + 9) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

monsters.name: Balor
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.desc: When the balor dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 70 (20d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion ignites flammable objects in that area that aren't being worn or carried, and it destroys the balor's weapons.

traits.name: Fire Aura
traits.desc: At the start of each of the balor's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the balor or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) fire damage.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The balor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The balor's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The balor makes two attacks: one with its longsword and one with its whip.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 21 (3d8 + 8) slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) lightning damage. If the balor scores a critical hit, it rolls damage dice three times, instead of twice.

actions.name: Whip
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. 15 (2d6 + 8) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) fire damage, and the target must succeed on a 20 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 25 feet toward the balor.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: The balor magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

monsters.name: Nightwalker
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Annihilating Aura
traits.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the nightwalker must succeed on a 21 Constitution saving throw or take 14 (4d6) necrotic damage and grant the nightwalker advantage on attack rolls against it until the start of the creature's next turn. Undead are immune to this aura.

traits.name: Life Eater
traits.desc: A creature reduced to 0 hit points from damage dealt by the nightwalker dies and can't be revived by any means short of a wish spell.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The nightwalker uses Enervating Focus twice, or it uses Enervating Focus and Finger of Doom, if available.

actions.name: Enervating Focus
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 28 (5d8 + 6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a 21 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

actions.name: Finger of Doom (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The nightwalker points at one creature it can see within 300 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 21 Wisdom saving throw or take 26 (4d12) necrotic damage and become frightened until the end of the nightwalker's next turn. While frightened in this way, the creature is also paralyzed. If a target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to the nightwalker's Finger of Doom for the next 24 hours.

monsters.name: Dragon Turtle
monsters.damage_resistances: fire

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The dragon turtle can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon turtle makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws. It can make one tail attack in place of its two claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 26 (3d12 + 7) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 16 (2d8 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 26 (3d12 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 20 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the dragon turtle and knocked prone.

actions.name: Steam Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon turtle exhales scalding steam in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 52 (15d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Being underwater doesn't grant resistance against this damage.

traits.name: Mouth of Madness
traits.desc: The giant is immune to confusion spells and similar magic. On each of its turns, the giant uses all its movement to move toward the nearest creature or whatever else it might perceive as food. Roll a d10 at the start of each of the giant's turns to determine its action for that turn: 1–3. The giant makes three attacks with its fists against one random target within its reach. If no other creatures are within its reach, the giant flies into a rage and gains advantage on all attack rolls until the end of its next turn. 4–5. The giant makes one attack with its fist against every creature within its reach. If no other creatures are within its reach, the giant makes one fist attack against itself. 6–7. The giant makes one attack with its bite against one random target within its reach. If no other creatures are within its reach, its eyes glaze over and it becomes stunned until the start of its next turn. 8–10. The giant makes three attacks against one random target within its reach: one attack with its bite and two with its fists. If no other creatures are within its reach, the giant flies into a rage and gains advantage on all attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 15 (3d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the giant magically regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Magmin
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Death Burst
traits.desc: When the magmin dies, it explodes in a burst of fire and magma. Each creature within 10 feet of it must make a 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried in that area are ignited.

traits.name: Ignited Illumination
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the magmin can set itself ablaze or extinguish its flames. While ablaze, the magmin sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

actions.name: Touch
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (2d6) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 3 (1d6) fire damage at the end of each of its turns.

traits.name: Aberrant Quickness (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: The choker can take an extra action on its turn.

traits.name: Boneless
traits.desc: The choker can move through and occupy a space as narrow as 4 inches wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The choker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The choker makes two tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the choker can't use this tentacle on another target. The choker has two tentacles. If this attack is a critical hit, the target also can't breathe or speak until the grapple ends.

monsters.name: The Angry
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing while in dim light or darkness

traits.name: Two Heads
traits.desc: The Angry has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

traits.name: Rising Anger
traits.desc: If another creature deals damage to the Angry, the Angry's attack rolls have advantage until the end of its next turn, and the first time it hits with a hook attack on its next turn, the attack's target takes an extra 19 (3d12) psychic damage. On its turn, the Angry has disadvantage on attack rolls if no other creature has dealt damage to it since the end of its last turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Angry makes two hook attacks.

actions.name: Hook
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 16 (2d12 + 3) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Zaratan
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.senses: darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 15

traits.name: Earth-Shaking Movement
traits.desc: As a bonus action after moving at least 10 feet on the ground, the zaratan can send a shock wave through the ground in a 120-foot-radius circle centered on itself. That area becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute. Each creature on the ground that is concentrating must succeed on a 25 Constitution saving throw or the creature's concentration is broken. The shock wave deals 100 thunder damage to all structures in contact with the ground in the area. If a creature is near a structure that collapses, the creature might be buried; a creature within half the distance of the structure's height must make a 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 17 (5d6) bludgeoning damage, is knocked prone, and is trapped in the rubble. A trapped creature is restrained, requiring a successful 20 Strength (Athletics) check as an action to escape. Another creature within 5 feet of the buried creature can use its action to clear rubble and grant advantage on the check. If three creatures use their actionsactions:

traits.name: Multiattack
traits.desc: The zaratan makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its stomp.

traits.name: Bite
traits.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 28 (4d8 + 10) piercing damage.

traits.name: Stomp
traits.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 26 (3d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Spit Rock
traits.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +17 to hit, range 120/240 ft., one target. 31 (6d8 + 10) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Spew Debris (Recharge 5-6)
traits.desc: The zaratan exhales rocky debris in a 90-foot cube. Each creature in that area must make a 25 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 33 (6d10) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more is knocked prone.

legendary_actions.name: Stomp
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan makes one stomp attack.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan moves up to its speed.

legendary_actions.name: Spit (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan uses Spit Rock.

legendary_actions.name: Retract (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan retracts into its shell. Until it takes its Emerge action, it has resistance to all damage, and it is restrained. The next time it takes a legendary action, it must take its Revitalize or Emerge action.

legendary_actions.name: Revitalize (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan can use this option only if it is retracted in its shell. It regains 52 (5d20) hit points. The next time it takes a legendary action, it must take its Emerge action.

legendary_actions.name: Emerge (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan emerges from its shell and uses Spit Rock. It can use this option only if it is retracted in its shell.

monsters.name: Dao

traits.name: Earth Glide
traits.desc: The dao can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the dao doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

traits.name: Elemental Demise
traits.desc: If the dao dies, its body disintegrates into crystalline powder, leaving behind only equipment the dao was wearing or carrying.

traits.name: Sure-Footed
traits.desc: The dao has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Dao makes two fist attacks or two maul attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Maul
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 20 (4d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 18 Strength check or be knocked prone.

spells: The dao's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect evil and good, detect magic, stone shape
3/day each: passwall, move earth, tongues
1/day each: conjure elemental (earth elemental only), gaseous form, invisibility, phantasmal killer, plane shift, wall of stone

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d6 - 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Eye Rays
actions.desc: The spectator shoots up to two of the following magical eye rays at one or two creatures it can see within 90 feet of it. It can use each ray only once on a turn.

actions.name: 1.  Confusion Ray
actions.desc: The target must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw, or it can't take reactions until the end of its next turn. On its turn, the target can't move, and it uses its action to make a melee or ranged attack against a randomly determined creature within range. If the target can't attack, it does nothing on its turn.

actions.name: 2.  Paralyzing Ray
actions.desc: The target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: 3.  Fear Ray
actions.desc: The target must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the spectator is visible to the target, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: 4.  Wounding Ray
actions.desc: The target must make a 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Create Food and Water
actions.desc: The spectator magically creates enough food and water to sustain itself for 24 hours.

reactions.name: Spell Reflection
reactions.desc: If the spectator makes a successful saving throw against a spell, or a spell attack misses it, the spectator can choose another creature (including the spellcaster) it can see within 30 feet of it. The spell targets the chosen creature instead of the spectator. If the spell forced a saving throw, the chosen creature makes its own save. If the spell was an attack, the attack roll is rerolled against the chosen creature.

monsters.name: Retriever
monsters.damage_immunities: necrotic, poison, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 15
monsters.languages: understands Abyssal, Elvish, and Undercommon but can't speak

traits.name: Faultless Tracker
traits.desc: The retriever is given a quarry by its master. The quarry can be a specific creature or object the master is personally acquainted with, or it can be a general type of creature or object the master has seen before. The retriever knows the direction and distance to its quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence. The retriever can have only one such quarry at a time. The retriever also always knows the location of its master.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The retriever makes two foreleg attacks and uses its force or paralyzing beam once, if available.

actions.name: Foreleg
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Force Beam
actions.desc: The retriever targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (5d10) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Paralyzing Beam (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The retriever targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 18 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The paralyzed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the paralyzed creature is Medium or smaller, the retriever can pick it up as part of the retriever's move and walk or climb with it at full speed.

spells: The retriever's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 13). The retriever can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.
3/day each: plane shift (only self and up to one incapacitated creature which is considered willing for the spell), web

monsters.name: Faerie Dragon (Blue)

traits.name: The Colors of Age
traits.desc: A faerie dragon's scales change hue as it ages, moving through all the colors of the rainbow. All faerie dragons have innate spellcasting ability, gaining new spells as they mature. Red—5 years or less Orange—6–10 years Yellow—11–20 years Green—21–30 years Blue—31–40 years Indigo—41–50 years Violet—51 years or more A green or older faerie dragon's CR increases to 2.

traits.name: Superior Invisibility
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the dragon can magically turn invisible until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the dragon wears or carries is invisible with it.

traits.name: Limited Telepathy
traits.desc: Using telepathy, the dragon can magically communicate with any other faerie dragon within 60 feet of it.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The faerie dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 1 piercing damage.

actions.name: Euphoria Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a puff of euphoria gas at one creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 11 Wisdom saving throw, or for 1 minute, the target can't take reactions and must roll a d6 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior during the turn: 1–4. The target takes no action or bonus action and uses all of its movement to move in a random direction. 5–6. The target doesn't move, and the only thing it can do on its turn is make a 11 Wisdom saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The dragon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 13). It can innately cast a number of spells, requiring no material components:
1/day each: color spray, dancing lights, mage hand, major image, minor illusion, mirror image, suggestion

monsters.name: Yuan-ti Anathema
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, fire, lightning
monsters.senses: darkvision 60 ft., blindsight 30 ft., passive Perception 17

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The anathema has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Ophidiophobia Aura
traits.desc: Any creature of the anathema's choice, other than a snake or a yuan-ti, that starts its turn within 30 feet of the anathema and can see or hear it must succeed on a 17 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of snakes and yuan-ti. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this aura for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The anathema can use its action to polymorph into a Huge giant constrictor snake, or back into its true form. its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

traits.name: Six Heads
traits.desc: The anathema has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded. charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

actions.name: Multiattack (Anathema Form Only)
actions.desc: The anathema makes two claw attacks, one constrict attack, and one Flurry of Bites attack.

actions.name: Claw (Anathema Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage, and the target is grappled (escape 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and takes 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns, and the anathema can't constrict another target.

actions.name: Flurry of Bites
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 27 (6d6 + 6) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage.

spells: The anathema's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 17). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: animal friendship (snakes only)
3/day each: darkness, entangle, fear, haste, suggestion, polymorph
1/day each: divine word

monsters.name: Faerie Dragon (Violet)

traits.name: The Colors of Age
traits.desc: A faerie dragon's scales change hue as it ages, moving through all the colors of the rainbow. All faerie dragons have innate spellcasting ability, gaining new spells as they mature. Red—5 years or less Orange—6–10 years Yellow—11–20 years Green—21–30 years Blue—31–40 years Indigo—41–50 years Violet—51 years or more A green or older faerie dragon's CR increases to 2.

traits.name: Superior Invisibility
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the dragon can magically turn invisible until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the dragon wears or carries is invisible with it.

traits.name: Limited Telepathy
traits.desc: Using telepathy, the dragon can magically communicate with any other faerie dragon within 60 feet of it.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The faerie dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 1 piercing damage.

actions.name: Euphoria Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a puff of euphoria gas at one creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 11 Wisdom saving throw, or for 1 minute, the target can't take reactions and must roll a d6 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior during the turn: 1–4. The target takes no action or bonus action and uses all of its movement to move in a random direction. 5–6. The target doesn't move, and the only thing it can do on its turn is make a 11 Wisdom saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The dragon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 13). It can innately cast a number of spells, requiring no material components:
1/day each: color spray, dancing lights, hallucinatory terrain, mage hand, major image, minor illusion, mirror image, polymorph, suggestion

monsters.name: Drow Favored Consort

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: War Magic
traits.desc: When the drow uses its action to cast a spell, it can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drow makes three scimitar attacks.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 18 (4d8) poison damage. In addition, the target has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell the drow casts before the end of the drow's next turn.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +11 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target regains consciousness if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it.

spells: The drow's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 18). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
Cantrips (at will): mage hand, message, poison spray, shocking grasp, ray of frost
1st level (4 slots): burning hands, mage armor, magic missile, shield
2nd level (3 slots): gust of wind, invisibility, misty step, shatter
3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fireball, haste
4th level (3 slots): dimension door, Otiluke's resilient sphere
5th level (2 slots): cone of cold
6th level (1 slots): chain lightning
At will: dancing lights
1/day each: darkness, faerie fire, levitate (self only)

monsters.name: Drow House Captain

traits.name: Battle Command
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the drow targets one ally he can see within 30 feet of him. If the target can see or hear the drow, the target can use its reaction to make one melee attack or to take the Dodge or Hide action.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drow makes three attacks: two with his scimitar and one with his whip or his hand crossbow.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Whip
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage. If the target is an ally, it has advantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +8 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target regains consciousness if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The drow adds 3 to his AC against one melee attack that would hit him. To do so, the drow must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spells: The drow's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 13). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: dancing lights
1/day each: darkness, faerie fire, levitate (self only)

monsters: Symbaroum Monster The Black Plaque Termites

monsters.name: Symbaroum Monster The Black Plaque Termites
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing
monsters.condition_immunities: harmed, frightened, grap- pled, paralyzed, petri"ed, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Shadow
traits.desc: glossy-black like soaked charcoal (thoroughly corrupt)

traits.name: Swarm.
traits.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. !e swarm can’t regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

actions.name: Bites
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. Hit: 1 temporary Corruption plus either 5 (2d4) piercing damage or 2 (1d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer

monsters.note: GM_FlohFelixAljoscha/gamemaster_rules/monsters/Symbaroum Monsters/Symbaroum Monster The Black Plaque Termites.md

traits.name: Thirsty
traits.desc: If the managaal has no Corruption in its vessel of darkness, it has advantage on its attacks.

traits.name: Vessel of Darkness
traits.desc: The managaal can absorb excess Corruption. The vessel can hold up to 12 points of Corruption. If a managaal begins its turn with Corruption in its vessel, it reduces its vessel Corruption by 1. If the managaal would consume additional Cor- ruption, it instead vomits forth a managaal spawn and the vessel’s Corruption becomes 0.

actions.name: Bloody Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage and the target loses 1d4 temporary Corruption, with the managaal gaining the same amount.

reactions.name: Sidestep
reactions.desc: The managaal spawn can move up to half its speed when another creature comes within its reach without provoking an opportunity attack.

monsters.name: Yochlol
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The yochlol can use its action to polymorph into a form that resembles a female drow or giant spider, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The yochlol has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The yochlol can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.desc: The yochlol ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The yochlol makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Slam (Bite in Spider Form)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. (10 feet in demon form), one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning (piercing in spider form) damage plus 21 (6d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Mist Form
actions.desc: The yochlol transforms into toxic mist or reverts to its true form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is also transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies. While in mist form, the yochlol is incapacitated and can't speak. It has a flying speed of 30 feet, can hover, and can pass through any space that isn't airtight. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to nonmagical damage. While in mist form, the yochlol can enter a creature's space and stop there. Each time that creature starts its turn with the yochlol in its space, the creature must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. While poisoned in this way, the target is incapacitated.

spells: The yochlol's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 14). The yochlol can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect thoughts, web
1/day each: dominate person

monsters.name: Symbaroum Monster Monster Hunter
monsters.equipment: marlit cape (advantage on 1 stealth check/day), mechanical traps (3), strong poison (2)

traits.name: The Bigger they Are
traits.desc: the monster hunter has advantage on all attacks against creatures that are Large or bigger.

traits.name: Trapper
traits.desc: the monster hunter can use its action to deploy a mechanical trap within 5 feet of its po- sition. A creature that enters the area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 13 (2d12) piercing damage. the monster hunter is never affected by the trap, but treats the area around the trap as diffcult terrain.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: the monster hunter makes two attacks with its halberd.

actions.name: Halberd
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage. If poison is applied to the blade (requires

reactions.name: Polearm Master
reactions.desc: the monster hunter can make an attack on a creature that enters its reach.

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: if the rock buck moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a horn attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Horns
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Kick
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

reactions.name: Back-kick
reactions.desc: Back-kick. If a creature approaches the rock buck from behind it can kick them once they are in reach.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a creature it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success.

reactions.name: Sidestep
reactions.desc: The mare cat can move up to half its speed when another creature comes within its reach without provoking an opportunity attack.

monsters.name: Symbaroum Monster Blight-born Elk
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning from nonmagical weapons

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the elk moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with its Manypointed Black Antlers on the same turn, the target takes an extra 14 (4d6) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked [[5e Conditions Prone]]

traits.name: Congealed Blood.
traits.desc: The blight-born elk is resistant to bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The blight-born elk makes an attack with its Black Antlers and its Clawing Hooves

actions.name: Many-pointed Black Antlers
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (4d6 + 7) piercing damage and 2 (1d4) temporary Corruption.

actions.name: Clawing Hooves.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) slashing damage and 1 temporary Corruption.

actions.name: ROUND 1
actions.desc: Charge, Antlers

actions.name: ROUND 2 and following
actions.desc: Antlers, Hooves. How do I stop fight after that then?

reactions.name: Broad Antlers
reactions.desc: The wild tangle of the blight-born elk’s antlers provides natural cover against ranged weapons. When attacked, it twists unnaturally, placing the thorny antlers in the path of the missile. Add +3 to the elk’s AC

monsters.name: Symbaroum Monster Blaze Bug
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The blaze bug swarm has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that currently has less than its maximum hit points.

traits.name: Deadly Breath (Recharge 5–6)
traits.desc: The blaze bug swarm can release a lightning attack 30 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the area of effect must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) lightning damage on a failure and half that on a success.

traits.name: Swarm
traits.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can’t regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

actions.name: Bites
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d6) slashing damage or 3 (1d6) slashing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

monsters.name: Symbaroum Monster Chasm Stag
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing and slashing from nonmagical weapons

traits.name: Dodger
traits.desc: The chasm stag can use its bonus action to take the Dodge action.

actions.name: Spit Slime.
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, range 20/40 ft., one target. Hit: 1 bludgeoning damage and 1 temporary Corruption.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage and if the target is a creature it must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become [[202202102011 5e Conditions Poisoned]]. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success.

reactions.name: Blighted Horns
reactions.desc: When a creature comes into reach, the chasm stag can rake it with its slime-covered horns. The creature must make a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw or gain 2 (1d4) temporary Corruption.

traits.name: Nimble Escape
traits.desc: !e squire can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 $., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Crush

When it makes a melee weapon attack it adds +3 to its damage. the creature has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage while in the rage. the rage ends early if the creature ends its turn without having attacked a hostile creature since its last turn or taken damage since then. It can also use a bonus action to end the rage.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The crocodile can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 12). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the crocodile can't bite another target

monsters.name: Blue Guard Drake
monsters.damage_resistances: lightning
monsters.languages: understands Draconic but can't speak it

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drake attacks twice, once with its bite and once with its tail.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Sting
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 1 piercing damage, and the target must make a 9 Constitution saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the ox moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

traits.name: Beast of Burden
traits.desc: The oxen is considered to be a Huge animal for the purposes of determining its carrying capacity.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Bandit
monsters.alignment: neutral (law/chaos axis) or chaotic or good or neutral (good/evil axis) or evil

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +3 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Sting
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must make a 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The crab can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Awakened Tree
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing
monsters.languages: one language known by its creator

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the tree remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the dolphin moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a slam attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The dolphin can hold its breath for 20 minutes.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes two greatsword attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 28 (6d6 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +11 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Violet Fungus
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 6

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the violet fungus remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary fungus.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The fungus makes 1d4 Rotting Touch attacks.

actions.name: Rotting Touch
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 4 (1d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The ape makes two fist attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +9 to hit, range 50/100 ft., one target. 30 (7d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Githzerai Zerth

traits.name: Psychic Defense
traits.desc: While the githzerai is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The githzerai makes two unarmed strikes.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (3d8) psychic damage. This is a magic weapon attack.

spells: The githzerai's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: mage hand (the hand is invisible)
3/day each: feather fall, jump, see invisibility, shield
1/day each: phantasmal killer, plane shift

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.name: Shark Telepathy
traits.desc: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The sahuagin makes three attacks: one with his bite and two with his claws or trident.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d4 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Trident
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

monsters.name: Master Thief
monsters.languages: any one language (usually Common) plus Thieves' cant

traits.name: Cunning Action
traits.desc: On each of its turns, the thief can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

traits.name: Evasion
traits.desc: If the thief is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the thief instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
traits.desc: The thief deals an extra 14 (4d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the thief that isn't incapacitated and the thief doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The thief makes three attacks with its shortsword.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Uncanny Dodge
reactions.desc: The thief halves the damage that it takes from an attack that hits it. The thief must be able to see the attacker.

monsters.name: Swarm of Rot Grubs
monsters.damage_resistances: piercing, slashing
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained

traits.name: Swarm
traits.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny maggot. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

actions.name: Bites
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +0 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. The target is infested by 1d4 rot grubs. At the start of each of the target's turns, the target takes 1d6 piercing damage per rot grub infesting it. Applying fire to the bite wound before the end of the target's next turn deals 1 fire damage to the target and kills these rot grubs. After this time, these rot grubs are too far under the skin to be burned. If a target infested by rot grubs ends its turn with 0 hit points, it dies as the rot grubs burrow into its heart and kill it. Any effect that cures disease kills all rot grubs infesting the target.

traits.name: Chameleon Carapace
traits.desc: The thri-kreen can change the color of its carapace to match the color and texture of its surroundings. As a result, it has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.desc: The thri-kreen's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The thri-kreen makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also paralyzed while poisoned in this way. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (2d4 + 1) slashing damage.

traits.name: Martial Advantage
traits.desc: Once per turn, the hobgoblin can deal an extra 10 (3d6) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the hobgoblin that isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The hobgoblin makes two greatsword attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Javelin
