2/day each: fear, invisibility (self only)
1/day each: fireball

monsters.name: Gray Slaad
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 17

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The slaad can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The slaad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The slaad's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The slaad regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The slaad makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws or greatsword.

actions.name: Bite (Slaad Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws (Slaad Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

spells: The slaad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 14). The slaad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect magic, detect thoughts, invisibility (self only), mage hand, major image
2/day each: fear, fly, fireball, tongues
1/day each: plane shift (self only)

monsters.name: Yagnoloth
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 16

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The yagnoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The yagnoloth's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The yagnoloth makes one massive arm attack and one electrified touch attack, or it makes one massive arm attack and teleports before or after the attack.

actions.name: Electrified Touch
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 27 (6d8) lightning damage.

actions.name: Massive Arm
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 23 (3d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or is stunned until the end of the yagnoloth's next turn.

actions.name: Life Leech
actions.desc: The yagnoloth touches one incapacitated creature within 15 feet of it. The target takes 36 (7d8 + 4) necrotic damage, and the yagnoloth gains temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt. The target must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw, or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest, and the target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

actions.name: Battlefield Cunning (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: Up to two allied yugoloths within 60 feet of the yagnoloth that can hear it can use their reactions to make one melee attack each.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: The yagnoloth magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

spells: The yagnoloth's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 16). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: darkness, detect magic, dispel magic, invisibility (self only), suggestion
3/day each: lightning bolt

monsters.name: Amnizu
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the amnizu's darkvision.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The amnizu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The amnizu uses Poison Mind. It also makes two attacks: one with its whip and one with its Disruptive Touch.

actions.name: Taskmaster Whip
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 10 (2d4 + 5) slashing damage plus 33 (6d10) force damage.

actions.name: Disruptive Touch
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 44 (8d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Poison Mind
actions.desc: The amnizu targets one or two creatures that it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a 19 Wisdom saving throw or take 26 (4d12) necrotic damage and is blinded until the start of the amnizu's next turn.

actions.name: Forgetfulness (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The amnizu targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. That creature must make a 18 Intelligence saving throw and on a failure the target is stunned for 1 minute. A stunned creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target remains stunned for the full minute, it forgets everything it sensed, experienced, and learned during the last 5 hours.

reactions.name: Instinctive Charm
reactions.desc: When a creature within 60 feet of the amnizu makes an attack roll against it, and another creature is within the attack's range, the attacker must make a 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker must target the creature that is closest to it, not including the amnizu or itself. If multiple creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target. If the saving throw is successful, the attacker is immune to the amnizu's Instinctive Charm for 24 hours.

spells: The amnizu's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 19, +11 to hit with spell attacks). The amnizu can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: charm person, command
3/day each: dominate person, fireball
1/day each: dominate monster, feeblemind

monsters.name: Corpse Flower
monsters.senses: blindsight 120 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 12

traits.name: Corpses
traits.desc: When first encountered, a corpse flower contains the corpses of 1d6 + 3 humanoids. A corpse flower can hold the remains of up to nine dead humanoids. These remains have total cover against attacks and other effects outside the corpse flower. If the corpse flower dies, the corpses within it can be pulled free. While it has at least one humanoid corpse in its body, the corpse flower can use a bonus action to do one of the following:

traits.name: The corpse flower digests one humanoid corpse in its body and instantly regains 11 (2d10) hit points. Nothing of the digested body remains. Any equipment on the corpse is expelled from the corpse flower in its space.

The corpse flower animates one dead humanoid in its body, turning it into a zombie. The zombie appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the corpse flower and acts immediately after it in the initiative order. The zombie acts as an ally of the corpse flower but isn't under its control, and the flower's stench clings to it (see the Stench of Death trait).
Spider Climb
traits.desc: The corpse flower can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Stench of Death
traits.desc: Each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the corpse flower or one of its zombies must make a 14 Constitution saving throw, unless the creature is a construct or undead. On a failed save, the creature is incapacitated until the end of the turn. Creatures that are immune to poison damage or the poisoned condition automatically succeed on this saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the stench of all corpse flowers for 24 hours.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The corpse flower makes three tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or take 14 (4d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Harvest the Dead
actions.desc: The corpse flower grabs one unsecured dead humanoid within 10 feet of it and stuffs the corpse into itself, along with any equipment the corpse is wearing or carrying. The remains can be used with the Corpses trait.

monsters.name: Yeenoghu
monsters.damage_immunities: poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing that is nonmagical
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Yeenoghu fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Yeenoghu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: Yeenoghu's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Rampage
traits.desc: When Yeenoghu reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on his turn, Yeenoghu can take a bonus action to move up to half his speed and make a bite attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Yeenoghu makes three flail attacks. If an attack hits, he can cause it to create an additional effect of his choice or at random (each effect can be used only once per Multiattack): 1. The attack deals an extra 13 (2d12) bludgeoning damage.2. The target must succeed on a 17 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed until the start of Yeenoghu's next turn. 3.  The target must succeed on a 17 Wisdom saving throw or be affected by the confusion spell until the start of Yeenoghu's next turn.

actions.name: Flail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 15 (1d12 + 9) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 14 (1d10 + 9) piercing damage.

legendary_actions.name: Charge
legendary_actions.desc: Yeenoghu moves up to his speed.

legendary_actions.name: Swat Away
legendary_actions.desc: Yeenoghu makes a flail attack. If the attack hits, the target must succeed on a 24 Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet in a straight line away from Yeenoghu. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target falls prone.

legendary_actions.name: Savage (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Yeenoghu makes a bite attack against each creature within 10 feet of him.

spells: Yeenoghu's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect magic
3/day each: dispel magic, fear, invisibility
1/day each: teleport

monsters.name: Wastrilith
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The wastrilith can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Corrupt Water
traits.desc: At the start of each of the wastrilith's turns, exposed water within 30 feet of it is befouled. Underwater, this effect lightly obscures the area until a current clears it away. Water in containers remains corrupted until it evaporates. A creature that consumes this foul water or swims in it must make a 18 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the foul water for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 (4d6) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. At the end of this time, the poisoned creature must repeat the saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 18 (4d8) poison damage and is poisoned until it finishes a long rest. If another demon drinks the foul water as an action, it gains 11 (2d10) temporary hit points.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The wastrilith has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Undertow
traits.desc: As a bonus action when the wastrilith is underwater, it can cause all water within 60 feet of it to be difficult terrain for other creatures until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The wastrilith uses Grasping Spout and makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 30 (4d12 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (4d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Grasping Spout
actions.desc: The wastrilith magically launches a spout of water at one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a 17 Strength saving throw, and it has disadvantage if it's underwater. On a failed save, it takes 22 (4d8 + 4) acid damage and is pulled up to 60 feet toward the wastrilith. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.

monsters.name: Slithering Tracker
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, deafened, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, unconscious
monsters.languages: understands languages it knew in its previous form but can't speak

traits.name: Ambusher
traits.desc: In the first round of a combat, the slithering tracker has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised}.

traits.name: Damage Transfer
traits.desc: While grappling a creature, the slithering tracker takes only haIf the damage dealt to it, and the creature it is grappling takes the other half.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the slithering tracker remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a puddle, unless an observer succeeds on a 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check.

traits.name: Keen Tracker
traits.desc: The slithering tracker has advantage on Wisdom checks to track prey.

traits.name: Liquid Form
traits.desc: The slithering tracker can enter an enemy's space and stop there. It can also move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The slithering tracker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Watery Stealth
traits.desc: While underwater, the slithering tracker has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide, and it can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Life Leech
actions.desc: One Large or smaller creature that the slithering tracker can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a 13 Dexterity saving throw or be grappled (escape 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water. In addition, the grappled target takes 16 (3d10) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. The slithering tracker can grapple only one target at a time.

monsters.name: Bheur Hag

traits.name: Graystaff Magic
traits.desc: The hag carries a graystaff, a length of gray wood that is a focus for her inner power. She can ride the staff as if it were a broom of flying. While holding the staff, she can cast additional spells with her Innate Spellcasting trait (these spells are marked with an asterisk). If the staff is lost or destroyed, the hag must craft another, which takes a year and a day. Only a bheur hag can use a graystaff.

traits.name: Ice Walk
traits.desc: The hag can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost her extra moment.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Maddening Feast
actions.desc: The hag feasts on the corpse of one enemy within 5 feet of her that died within the past minute. Each creature of the hag's choice that is within 60 feet of her and able to see her must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of her for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, a creature is incapacitated, can't understand what others say, can't read, and speaks only in gibberish; the DM controls the creature's movement, which is erratic. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Maddening Feast for the next 24 hours.

spells: The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: hold person*, ray of frost
3/day each: cone of cold_, ice storm_, wall of ice*
1/day each: control weather

monsters.name: Mind Flayer

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The mind flayer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 15 (2d10 + 4) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape 15) and must succeed on a 15 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned until this grapple ends.

actions.name: Extract Brain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one incapacitated humanoid grappled by the mind flayer. The target takes 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the mind flayer kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

actions.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The mind flayer magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 15 Intelligence saving throw or take 22 (4d8 + 4) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The mind flayer's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: detect thoughts, levitate
1/day each: dominate monster, plane shift (self only)

monsters.name: Young Black Dragon
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 16

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The dragon can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Acid Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales acid in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 49 (11d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Duergar Hammerer
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Engine of Pain
traits.desc: Once per turn, a creature that attacks the hammerer can target the duergar trapped in it. The attacker has disadvantage on the attack roll. On a hit, the attack deals an extra 5 (1d10) damage to the hammerer, and the hammerer can respond by using its Multiattack with its reaction.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The hammerer deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The hammerer makes two attacks: one with its claw and one with its hammer.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Hammer
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Invisible Stalker
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious
monsters.languages: Auran, understands Common but doesn't speak it

traits.name: Invisibility
traits.desc: The stalker is invisible.

traits.name: Faultless Tracker
traits.desc: The stalker is given a quarry by its summoner. The stalker knows the direction and distance to its quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence. The stalker also knows the location of its summoner.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The stalker makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Young Red Dragon
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 18

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 56 (16d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Orc Eye of Gruumsh

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

traits.name: Gruumsh's Fury
traits.desc: The orc deals an extra 4 (1d8) damage when it hits with a weapon attack (included in the attacks).

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 11 (1d6 + 3 plus 1d8) piercing damage, or 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

spells: The orc is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks). The orc has the following cleric spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): guidance, resistance, thaumaturgy
1st level (4 slots): bless, command
2nd level (2 slots): augury, spiritual weapon (spear)

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the centaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a pike attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The centaur makes two attacks: one with its pike and one with its hooves or two with its longbow.

actions.name: Pike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Bandit Captain
monsters.alignment: neutral (law/chaos axis) or chaotic or good or neutral (good/evil axis) or evil

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The captain makes three melee attacks: two with its scimitar and one with its dagger. Or the captain makes two ranged attacks with its daggers.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The captain adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the captain must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

traits.name: Rampage
traits.desc: When the witherling reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, it can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The witherling makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its club, or two with its club.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Club
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

reactions.name: Vengeful Strike
reactions.desc: In response to a gnoll being reduced to 0 hit points within 30 feet of the witherling, the witherling makes a melee attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The wyvern makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its stinger. While flying, it can use its claws in place of one other attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Stinger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage. The target must make a 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Brute
traits.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

traits.name: Surprise Attack
traits.desc: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage from the attack.

actions.name: Morningstar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage in melee or 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage at range.

traits.name: Heated Body
traits.desc: A creature that touches the azer or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage.

traits.name: Heated Weapons
traits.desc: When the azer hits with a metal melee weapon, it deals an extra 3 (1d6) fire damage (included in the attack).

traits.name: Illumination
traits.desc: The azer sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

actions.name: Warhammer
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

monsters.name: Darkling
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 15

traits.name: Death Flash
traits.desc: When the darkling dies, nonmagical light flashes out from it in a 10-foot radius as its body and possessions, other than metal or magic objects, burn to ash. Any creature in that area and able to see the bright light must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the creature's next turn.

traits.name: Light Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in bright light, the darkling has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage. If the darkling has advantage on the attack roll, the attack deals an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Swarm of Bats
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Echolocation
traits.desc: The swarm can't use its blindsight while deafened.

traits.name: Keen Hearing
traits.desc: The swarm has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

traits.name: Swarm
traits.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny bat. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

actions.name: Bites
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. 5 (2d4) piercing damage, or 2 (1d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.desc: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Snow Camouflage
traits.desc: The wolf has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Cold Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The wolf exhales a blast of freezing wind in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Bone Naga (Spirit)

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

spells: The naga is a 5th-level spellcaster (spell save 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks) that needs only verbal components to cast its spells. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence, and it has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): mage hand, minor illusion, ray of frost
1st level (4 slots): charm person, sleep
2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, hold person
3rd level (2 slots): lightning bolt

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The steeder can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Extraordinary Leap
traits.desc: The distance of the steeder's long jumps is tripled; every foot of its walking speed that it spends on the jump allows it to jump 3 feet.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage.

actions.name: Sticky Leg
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Small or Tiny creature. The target is stuck to the steeder's leg and is grappled until it escapes (escape 12). The steeder can have only one creature grappled at a time.

monsters.name: Young Blue Dragon
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 19

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) lightning damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales lightning in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 (10d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Steam Mephit

traits.name: Death Burst
traits.desc: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a cloud of steam. Each creature within 5 feet of the mephit must succeed on a 10 Dexterity saving throw or take 4 (1d8) fire damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 2 (1d4) slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

actions.name: Steam Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of scalding steam. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 10 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The mephit can innately cast blur, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.
At will: blur

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The ogre deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Bash
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 15 (2d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the ogre can push the target 5 feet away if the target is Huge or smaller.

actions.name: Block the Path
actions.desc: Until the start of the ogre's next turn, attack rolls against the ogre have disadvantage, it has advantage on the attack roll it makes for an opportunity attack, and that attack deals an extra 16 (3d10) bludgeoning damage on a hit. Also, each enemy that tries to move out of the ogre's reach without teleporting must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the start of the ogre's next turn.

traits.name: Keen Sight and Smell
traits.desc: The vulture has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The vulture has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the vulture's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The vulture makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

actions.name: Beak
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Talons
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Mage

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

spells: The mage is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation
1st level (4 slots): detect magic, mage armor, magic missile, shield
2nd level (3 slots): misty step, suggestion
3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fireball, fly
4th level (3 slots): greater invisibility, ice storm
5th level (1 slots): cone of cold

traits.name: Stone Camouflage
traits.desc: The giant has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes two greatclub attacks.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +9 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reactions.name: Rock Catching
reactions.desc: If a rock or similar object is hurled at the giant, the giant can, with a successful 10 Dexterity saving throw, catch the missile and take no bludgeoning damage from it.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The catoblepas has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Stench
traits.desc: Any creature other than a catoblepas that starts its turn within 10 feet of the catoblepas must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of any catoblepas for 1 hour.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 21 (5d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the start of the catoblepas's next turn.

actions.name: Death Ray (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The catoblepas targets a creature that it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target instead takes 64 necrotic damage. The target dies if reduced to 0 hit points by this ray.

traits.name: Keen Sight
traits.desc: The hippogriff has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The hippogriff makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

actions.name: Beak
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Clay Golem
monsters.damage_immunities: acid, poison, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Acid Absorption
traits.desc: Whenever the golem is subjected to acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the acid damage dealt.

traits.name: Berserk
traits.desc: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 60 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The golem makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The target dies if this attack reduces its hit point maximum to 0. The reduction lasts until removed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

actions.name: Haste (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Until the end of its next turn, the golem magically gains a +2 bonus to its AC, has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and can use its slam attack as a bonus action.

monsters.name: Revenant
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic, psychic
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, stunned
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The revenant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the revenant takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the revenant's next turn. The revenant's body is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: When the revenant's body is destroyed, its soul lingers. After 24 hours, the soul inhabits and animates another humanoid corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all its hit points. While the soul is bodiless, a wish spell can be used to force the soul to go to the afterlife and not return.

traits.name: Turn Immunity
traits.desc: The revenant is immune to effects that turn undead.

traits.name: Vengeful Tracker
traits.desc: The revenant knows the distance to and direction of any creature against which it seeks revenge, even if the creature and the revenant are on different planes of existence. If the creature being tracked by the revenant dies, the revenant knows.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The revenant makes two fist attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature against which the revenant has sworn vengeance, the target takes an extra 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the revenant can grapple the target (escape 14) provided the target is Large or smaller.

actions.name: Vengeful Glare
actions.desc: The revenant targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it and against which it has sworn vengeance. The target must make a 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is paralyzed until the revenant deals damage to it, or until the end of the revenant's next turn. When the paralysis ends, the target is frightened of the revenant for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if it can see the revenant, ending the frightened condition on itself on a success.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The hag can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Horrific Appearance
traits.desc: Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see the hag's true form must make a 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours. Unless the target is {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Death Glare
actions.desc: The hag targets one frightened creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the hag, it must succeed on a 11 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or drop to 0 hit points.

actions.name: Illusory Appearance
actions.desc: The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like an ugly creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The effect ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies. The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have no claws, but someone touching her hand might feel the claws. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a 16 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

monsters.name: Faerie Dragon (Indigo)

traits.name: The Colors of Age
traits.desc: A faerie dragon's scales change hue as it ages, moving through all the colors of the rainbow. All faerie dragons have innate spellcasting ability, gaining new spells as they mature. Red—5 years or less Orange—6–10 years Yellow—11–20 years Green—21–30 years Blue—31–40 years Indigo—41–50 years Violet—51 years or more A green or older faerie dragon's CR increases to 2.

traits.name: Superior Invisibility
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the dragon can magically turn invisible until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the dragon wears or carries is invisible with it.

traits.name: Limited Telepathy
traits.desc: Using telepathy, the dragon can magically communicate with any other faerie dragon within 60 feet of it.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The faerie dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 1 piercing damage.

actions.name: Euphoria Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a puff of euphoria gas at one creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 11 Wisdom saving throw, or for 1 minute, the target can't take reactions and must roll a d6 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior during the turn: 1–4. The target takes no action or bonus action and uses all of its movement to move in a random direction. 5–6. The target doesn't move, and the only thing it can do on its turn is make a 11 Wisdom saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The dragon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 13). It can innately cast a number of spells, requiring no material components:
1/day each: color spray, dancing lights, hallucinatory terrain, mage hand, major image, minor illusion, mirror image, suggestion

monsters.name: Bael
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Dreadful
traits.desc: Bael can use a bonus action to appear dreadful until the start of his next turn. Each creature, other than a devil, that starts its turn within 10 feet of Bael must succeed on a 22 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the start of the creature's next turn.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Bael fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Bael has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: Bael's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Bael regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes cold or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Bael dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Bael makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Hellish Morningstar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 16 (2d8 + 7) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Infernal Command
actions.desc: Each ally of Bael's within 60 feet of him can't be charmed or frightened until the end of his next turn.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: Bael magically teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing and carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

legendary_actions.name: Attack (Cost 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Bael attacks once with his hellish morningstar.

legendary_actions.name: Awaken Greed
legendary_actions.desc: Bael casts charm person or major image.

legendary_actions.name: Infernal Command
legendary_actions.desc: Bael uses his Infernal Command action.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
legendary_actions.desc: Bael uses his Teleport action.

spells: Bael's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 21, +13 to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: alter self (can become Medium when changing his appearance), animate dead, charm person, detect magic, inflict wounds (as an 8th-level spell), invisibility (self only), major image
3/day each: counterspell, dispel magic, fly, suggestion, wall of fire
1/day each: dominate monster, symbol (stunning only)

monsters: Symbaroum Monster Magistrate CR too high

monsters.name: Symbaroum Monster Magistrate CR too high
monsters.equipment: order medallion, field library, 1d4 doses elemental essence and herbal cures

traits.name: Archivist
traits.desc: The magistrate has advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks while researching in archives and libraries.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.note: GM_FlohFelixAljoscha/gamemaster_rules/monsters/Symbaroum Monsters/Symbaroum Monster Magistrate CR too high.md

traits.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
traits.desc: the robber chief deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the robber chief that isn’t incapacitated and the robber chief doesn’t have disadvantage on the attack roll.

traits.name: Cunning Action
traits.desc: the robber chief can take a bonus action to Dash, Disengage or Hide.

traits.name: Expertise
traits.desc: the robber chief has expertise in Percep- tion and Stealth.

traits.name: Off-hand Attack
traits.desc: the robber chief can use its bonus action to make another attack with its shortsword.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Acrobatic Fighter
reactions.desc: the robber chief can make a Dexterity (Acrobatics) check with the attack roll as the DC to take half damage from an attack on a success.

monsters.name: Mind Flayer Arcanist

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The mind flayer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 15 (2d10 + 4) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape 15) and must succeed on a 15 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned until this grapple ends.

actions.name: Extract Brain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one incapacitated humanoid grappled by the mind flayer. The target takes 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the mind flayer kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

actions.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The mind flayer magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 15 Intelligence saving throw or take 22 (4d8 + 4) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The mind flayer's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
Cantrips (at will): blade ward, dancing lights, mage hand, shocking grasp
1st level (4 slots): detect magic, disguise self, shield, sleep
2nd level (3 slots): blur, invisibility, ray of enfeeblement
3rd level (3 slots): clairvoyance, lightning bolt, sending
4th level (3 slots): confusion, hallucinatory terrain
5th level (2 slots): telekinesis, wall of force
At will: detect thoughts, levitate
1/day each: dominate monster, plane shift (self only)

monsters.name: Couatl
monsters.damage_immunities: psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.damage_resistances: radiant

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The couatl's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Shielded Mind
traits.desc: The couatl is immune to scrying and to any effect that would sense its emotions, read its thoughts, or detect its location.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 24 hours. Until this poison ends, the target is unconscious. Another creature can use an action to shake the target awake.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the couatl can't constrict another target.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.desc: The couatl magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the couatl's choice). In a new form, the couatl retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and other actions are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks. If the new form has a bite attack, the couatl can use its bite in that form.

spells: The couatl's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:
At will: detect evil and good, detect magic, detect thoughts
3/day each: bless, create food and water, cure wounds, lesser restoration, protection from poison, sanctuary, shield
1/day each: dream, greater restoration, scrying

monsters.name: Dryad

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
traits.desc: The dryad can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

traits.name: Tree Stride
traits.desc: Once on her turn, the dryad can use 10 feet of her movement to step magically into one living tree within her reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be large or bigger.

actions.name: Club
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit (+6 to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

actions.name: Fey Charm
actions.desc: The dryad targets one humanoid or beast that she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the dryad, it must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed. The charmed creature regards the dryad as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the dryad's control, it takes the dryad's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can. Each time the dryad or its allies do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the dryad dies, is on a different plane of existence from the target, or ends the effect as a bonus action. If a target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to the dryad's Fey Charm for the next 24 hours. The dryad can have no more than one humanoid and up to three beasts charmed at a time.

spells: The dryad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 14). The dryad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: druidcraft
3/day each: entangle, goodberry
1/day each: barkskin, pass without trace, shillelagh

monsters.name: Ki-rin
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 19

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the ki-rin fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The ki-rin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The ki-rin's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The ki-rin makes three attacks: two with its hooves and one with its horn.

actions.name: Hoof
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 10 (2d4 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Horn
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.desc: The ki-rin makes a Wisdom (Perception) check or a Wisdom (Insight) check.

legendary_actions.name: Smite
legendary_actions.desc: The ki-rin makes a hoof attack or casts sacred flame.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: The ki-rin moves up to its half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

spells: The ki-rin's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 17). The ki-rin can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
Cantrips (at will): light, mending, sacred flame, spare the dying, thaumaturgy
1st level (4 slots): command, cure wounds, detect evil and good, protection from evil and good, sanctuary
2nd level (3 slots): calm emotions, lesser restoration, silence
3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, remove curse, sending
4th level (3 slots): banishment, freedom of movement, guardian of faith
5th level (3 slots): greater restoration, mass cure wounds, scrying
6th level (1 slots): heroes' feast, true seeing
7th level (1 slots): etherealness, plane shift
8th level (1 slots): control weather
9th level (1 slots): true resurrection
At will: gaseous form, major image (6th-level version), wind walk
1/day each: create food and water

monsters.name: Symbaroum Monster Necromage
monsters.damage_immunities: necrotic, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Expertise
traits.desc: The necromage has expertise in Arcana and History.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The necromage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Terrifying
traits.desc: Each creature that starts its turn within 120 feet of the necromage must pass a DC 18 Charisma saving throw or become frightened of it. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success. Creatures that succeed are immune to this effect for 24 hours.

spells: Innate Spellcasting. The necromage’s innate spellcast- ing ability is Charisma (+10 to hit, spell save DC 18). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.
At will:[[5e Spell Symbaroum Spell Accurate Strike]], [[5e spells chill_touch 1d8 dmg w]], [[5e spells dancing_lights w]], [[5e spells ray of frost 1d8 dmg slowed down w]]

5/day each: [[5e spells Symbaroum Spells Black Bolt]], [[5e spells comprehend_languages but not speak w]], [[5e spells false life buff hp w]], [[mage_armor AC 13 w]], [[5e spells magic missile 3 x 1d4 plus 1 w]], [[shield w]]
3/day each: [[5e spells hold person paralyzed wc]], [[5e spell invisibility w]], [[suggestion mind control w]]
2/day each: [[5e spells counterspell interrupt w]],[[5e spells Symbaroum Spells Larvae boil]],  [[lightning_bolt 1 creat 8d6 w]]
1/day each:[[black_tentacles terrain control w]], [[dimension_door teleport to visible w]], [[polymorph into creature w]]

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The necromage makes two attacks; one with its Wraith Claws, one with its Soul Touch.

actions.name: Wraith Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage and the target must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Soul Touch
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 temporary Corruption and 14 (3d6 + 4) necrotic damage and the necromage regains hit points equal to half of the necrotic damage (rounded down).

reactions.name: Death Cry (Recharge 5–6)
reactions.desc: The necromage wails a keening cry that transcends the borders between life and death. Each creature that hears it must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking necrotic damage equal to their current Corruption total on a failure.

reactions.name: Sudden Touch
reactions.desc: If a creature moves within reach, the necromage makes either a Wraith Claws or Soul Touch attack.

monsters.name: Symbaroum Monster Arach Exalted
monsters.languages: The languages it knew before being transformed; Spider-tongue

traits.name: Chitin Armor
traits.desc: The arach’s armor class is equal to 10 plus its Dexterity modifier and its Constitution modifier.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/day)
traits.desc: If the arach exalted fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: Arach exalted can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.desc: While in contact with a web, the arach exalted knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.desc: The arach exalted ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage and the creature must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature takes 18 (4d8) poison damage at the start of its turn and can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effects on a success.

actions.name: Web (Recharge 5–6)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: The creature is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained creature can make a DC 14 Strength check, escaping from the webbing on a success. The effect also ends if the webbing is destroyed. The webbing has AC 10, 15 hit points, vulnerability to fire damage, and immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage.

actions.name: Lair Action
actions.desc: none

actions.name: Harmful Aura
actions.desc: If the arach exalted is within its territo- ry, it can, on initiative count 20 (losing all ties) release tiny hairs into the air, causing irritation to creatures’ within 60 feet of it. Arachs and spiders are not affected by the hairs. Other creatures must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw at the start of their turn. On a failure, the irritation is equivalent to the character being [[poisoned]] until the beginning of its next turn. An arach exalted cannot use this lair action if it is incapacitated or otherwise can’t take actions. If surprised, it can’t use it until after its first turn in the combat.

legendary_actions.name: The arach exalted can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below
legendary_actions.desc: Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The arach exalted regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Command
legendary_actions.desc: The arach exalted can select another arach which takes its turn next, instead of at its normal initiative count. This effect lasts for only one round.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The arach exalted can make a bite attack

legendary_actions.name: Recharge (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The arach exalted automatically recharges its web feature.

traits.name: Enlarge (Recharge 5–6)
traits.desc: The bestiaal uses its bonus action to increase in size one step, along with anything it is wearing or carrying for 1 minute. It gains 6 temporary hit points. It does an additional 1d4 damage on melee attacks while enlarged.

traits.name: Leathery Skin
traits.desc: The bestiaal’s armor class is equal to 12 plus its dexterity modifier if it is not wearing armor.

traits.name: Metamorphosis
traits.desc: The bestiaal can use a bonus action to change its body, changing its enlarge, leathery skin or claws traits out for others given on page 15.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The bestiaal makes two claws attacks.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Choose up to Three
bonus_actions.desc: Glint Carrriers get four

bonus_actions.name: Aggressive
bonus_actions.desc: The bestiaal can use its bonus action to move a distance equal to its speed towards a hostile creature it can see.

bonus_actions.name: Awareness
bonus_actions.desc: The bestiaal has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

bonus_actions.name: Blood Frenzy
bonus_actions.desc: The bestiaal has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that currently has less than its maximum hit points.

bonus_actions.name: Bite
bonus_actions.desc: Str or Dex The bestiaal makes an attack against a target within 5 feet. To hit is its proficiency bonus (2, or 3 for glint-carrier) plus the chosen ability modifier. On a hit, it does 1d8 plus chosen ability modifier in piercing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Claws
bonus_actions.desc: Str or Dex.The bestiaal makes an attack against a target within 5 feet. To hit is its proficiency bonus (2, or 3 for glint-carrier) plus the chosen ability modifier. On a hit, it does 1d8 plus chosen ability modifier in slashing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Enlarge  (Recharge 5–6)
bonus_actions.desc: The bestiaal uses its bonus action to increase in size one step, along with anything it is wearing or carrying for 1 minute. It gains temporary hit points equal to its number of Hit Dice. It does an additional 1d4 damage on melee attacks while enlarged.

bonus_actions.name: Leathery Skin
bonus_actions.desc: Dex.The bestiaal’s armor class is equal to 12 plus its Dexterity modifier.

bonus_actions.name: Reduce  (Recharge 5–6)
bonus_actions.desc: .The bestiaal uses its bonus action to reduce in size by one step, along with anything it is wearing or carrying until the beginning of its next turn. Its current and maximum hit points are reduced by its number of Hit Dice (to a minimum of 1 hit point). Its melee attack does the minimum possible damage (as if the bestiaal rolled a 1 on all damage dice).

bonus_actions.name: Wings
bonus_actions.desc: The bestiaal gains a flight speed of 30 feet.

monsters.name: Elder Brain
monsters.languages: understands Common, Deep Speech, and Undercommon but can't speak, telepathy 5 miles

traits.name: Creature Sense
traits.desc: The elder brain is aware of the presence of creatures within 5 miles of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each one's intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the elder brain fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The elder brain has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Telepathic Hub
traits.desc: The elder brain can use its telepathy to initiate and maintain telepathic conversations with up to ten creatures at a time. The elder brain can let those creatures telepathically hear each other while connected in this way.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. 20 (4d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 15) and takes 9 (1d8 + 5) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the grapple ends. The elder brain can have up to four targets grappled at a time.

actions.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The elder brain magically emits psychic energy. Creatures of the elder brain's choice within 60 feet of it must succeed on a 18 Intelligence saving throw or take 32 (5d10 + 5) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Psychic Link
actions.desc: The elder brain targets one incapacitated creature it can perceive with its Creature Sense trait and establishes a psychic link with that creature. Until the psychic link ends, the elder brain can perceive everything the target senses. The target becomes aware that something is linked to its mind once it is no longer incapacitated, and the elder brain can terminate the link at any time (no action required). The target can use an action on its turn to attempt to break the psychic link, doing so with a successful 18 Charisma saving throw. On a successful save, the target takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage. The psychic link also ends if the target and the elder brain are more than 5 miles apart, with no consequences to the target. The elder brain can form psychic links with up to ten creatures at a time.

actions.name: Sense Thoughts
actions.desc: The elder brain targets a creature with which it has a psychic link. The elder brain gains insight into the target's reasoning, its emotional state, and thoughts that loom large in its mind (including things the target worries about, loves, or hates). The elder brain can also make a Charisma (Deception) check with advantage to deceive the target's mind into thinking it believes one idea or feels a particular emotion. The target contests this attempt with a Wisdom (Insight) check. If the elder brain succeeds, the mind believes the deception for 1 hour or until evidence of the lie is presented to the target.

legendary_actions.name: Tentacle
legendary_actions.desc: The elder brain makes a tentacle attack.

legendary_actions.name: Break Concentration
legendary_actions.desc: The elder brain targets a creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. The elder brain breaks the creature's concentration on a spell it has cast. The creature also takes 1d4 psychic damage per level of the spell.

legendary_actions.name: Psychic Pulse
legendary_actions.desc: The elder brain targets a creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. Enemies of the elder brain within 10 feet of that creature take 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

legendary_actions.name: Sever Psychic Link
legendary_actions.desc: The elder brain targets a creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. The elder brain ends the link, causing the creature to have disadvantage on all ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of the creature's next turn.

spells: The elder brain's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 18). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: detect thoughts, levitate
1/day each: dominate monster, plane shift (self only)

monsters.name: Symbaroum Monster Primal Blight Beast
monsters.damage_immunities: necrotic, poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Acidic Blood
traits.desc: A creature that attacks the primal blight beast with a melee weapon takes 4 (1d8) acid damage and 2 (1d4) temporary Corruption from its blood spattering onto their body.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/day)
traits.desc: If the creature fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The primal blight beast regains 12 hit points at the start of its turn unless it took radiant damage since the beginning of its last turn.

traits.name: Wave of Corruption (Recharge 5–6)
traits.desc: The primal blight beast uses its bonus action to cause each creature within 60 feet of it to make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or gain 2 (1d4) temporary Corruption.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The primal blight beast makes two attacks with its Defiling Claws.

actions.name: Defiling Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d6 + 8) slashing damage and 1 temporary Corruption.

legendary_actions.name: The primal blight beast can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The primal blight beast regains its spent legendary action at the start of its turn.
Claws
legendary_actions.desc: The primal blight beast makes a Defiling Claws attack.

legendary_actions.name: Recover
legendary_actions.desc: The primal blight beast recovers its Wave of Corruption feature.

monsters.name: Symbaroum Monster skullbiter Queen
monsters.damage_immunities: psychic; bludgeoning and slashing from nonmagical weapons

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the skullbiter can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can sense.

traits.name: Carapace
traits.desc: The skullbiter can close itself up in its shell and roll towards its enemies. When rolled up, enemies have disadvantage on attack rolls, the skullbiter has resistance to all damage, and it cannot attack. Rolling itself up or unrolling requires a bonus action.

traits.name: Earthbound
traits.desc: The skullbiter’s Corruption total reduces its current and maximum hit points. If its Corruption total is above 0 and the skullbiter reaches 0 hit points then it becomes unconscious, waking up after  a short rest. The skullbiter does not gain Marks of Corruption when it exceeds its Corruption Threshold. Another creature can slay the skullbiter by doing additional damage equal to or above its original, unmodified hit point total

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/day)
traits.desc: If the skullbiter fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Mystical Resistance
traits.desc: [[Symbaroum Traits Mystical Resistance]] throw back attack spells [[202204051140 Monster Erez]]  weiß dass die [[202203292238 Monster Spinne Goldene Prophetin Sonne Skullbiter Queen]] eine Antimagische Kraft verbreitet [[antimagic_field wc]], so dass er sich nicht an sie anschleichen kann mit [[5e spell invisibility w]]

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The skullbiter makes three bite attacks. Bite. Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (1d12 + 7) piercing damage.

legendary_actions.name: The skullbiter queen can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below
legendary_actions.desc: Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The skullbiter queen regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Bite
legendary_actions.desc: The skullbiter queen makes a bite attack.

legendary_actions.name: Carapace
legendary_actions.desc: The skullbiter queen either rolls itself up or unrolls itself.

legendary_actions.name: Smash (Costs 2 Actions, must be rolled up)
legendary_actions.desc: The skullbiter queen rolls towards a target up to 30 feet away. The target must succeed at a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 (1d20 + 7) bludgeoning damage on a failure or half that damage on a success.

reactions.name: Roll Over
reactions.desc: When a smaller creature comes within reach and the skullbiter is rolled up, it can rotate its body to crush the creature between itself and the ground. The creature takes 17 (1d20 + 7) bludgeon- ing damage.

monsters.name: Symbaroum Monster Nightmare
monsters.damage_immunities: (only when incorporeal) acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing and slashing from nonmagical weapons

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: When the nightmare is not possessing a creature it is invisible and can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Possession
traits.desc: [[20220210209 5e Conditions Possessed]] One humanoid that the nightmare touches must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (the DC is 10 plus the target’s total Corruption) or be possessed by the nightmare; the nightmare then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and   loses control of its body. The nightmare can now take control of the body – when the nightmare is   in control, the victim retains no memories of its dees or events during that time. The nightmare can’t be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target’s statistics and surface knowledge, but doesn’t gain access to the target’s secrets, class features, or proficiencies. Its armor class is 10 plus the target’s Dexterity modifier and its to-hit value is its proficiency bonus plus the higher of the target’s Strength or Dexterity modifiers. The possession lasts until the creature is slain, the nightmare ends it as a bonus action, or the nightmare is turned or forced out by an effect like the [[5e spells Symbaroum Rituals Exorcism]] spell. When the possession ends, the nightmare reappears in an unoccupied space with- in 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this nightmare’s Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

actions.name: Lifedrain
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +2 or higher to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 or higher to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8 +0 or higher) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Fade
reactions.desc: The nightmare shifts itself towards the Spirit World, taking only half damage from an attack.

traits.name: Blood Frenzy

traits.name: Leathery Skin

traits.name: Metamorphosis
traits.desc: The bestiaal can use a bonus action to change its body, changing its aggressive, blood frenzy, enlarge, or leathery skin traits out for others given on page 15.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The bestiaal makes two axe attacks.

actions.name: Axe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The bestiaal adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the bestiaal must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

bonus_actions.name: Choose up to Three
bonus_actions.desc: Glint Carrriers get four
